This adds a utility script for querying the release name of the
image we're building, based on either setup.cfg or PBR, and tags
the built image accordingly.  This'll let us build and publish
images for different branches/releases.

Change-Id: I04822925cdf8ae43eb9b7b4078adeca1bb6dee4a
"}]
commit_message:
Update img build scripts to build per-branch images

This adds a utility script for querying the release name of the
image we're building, based on either setup.cfg or PBR, and tags
the built image accordingly.  This'll let us build and publish
images for different branches/releases.

Change-Id: I04822925cdf8ae43eb9b7b4078adeca1bb6dee4a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-22 15:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/scheduler/filters/test_capabilities.py', 'manila/scheduler/filters/capabilities.py'], 'message': "Capability lists in Manila scheduler

Some share drivers would like to report pool capabilities such as
'compression': [True, False] to denote a pool which can simultaneously
handle shares with compression enabled and others with compression
disabled. This commit enhances the CapabilitiesFilter to handle this
use case.  An extra spec value will be compared to a capability list
and will be passed by the filter if it matches anything in the list.

Implements: blueprint support-lists-in-capabilities-filter
Change-Id: I50963a7cde54c10632ecf5caba2ee436073da8f8
"}]
commit_message:
Capability lists in Manila scheduler

Some share drivers would like to report pool capabilities such as
'compression': [True, False] to denote a pool which can simultaneously
handle shares with compression enabled and others with compression
disabled. This commit enhances the CapabilitiesFilter to handle this
use case.  An extra spec value will be compared to a capability list
and will be passed by the filter if it matches anything in the list.

Implements: blueprint support-lists-in-capabilities-filter
Change-Id: I50963a7cde54c10632ecf5caba2ee436073da8f8

commit_message:
Failed to call refresh Apache service

Apache service should be refreshed only in correct order after tidying
mods-enabled directory. In this case better to use the 'File' resource
instead of 'Tidy' resource because last doesn't support notify mechanisms.
Also, we need to remove only 'MPM event' configuration files wich enabled
by default only on the Debian (Ubuntu) systems.

Change-Id: I79f6a5409cd01135e703bca1ebc4d97b9e8f4628
Closes-Bug: #1527256
Closes-Bug: #1522857

commit_message:
Don't raise if polling manager is running when stopped

AsyncProcess.stop() will raise if the process we are trying
to stop is not running. Some functional tests sporadically
fail because in the clean up the polling manager is stopped
without checking if it's still running. Add an except
in InterfacePollingMinimizer.stop() to avoid raising an
exception when the monitor is not running.

Change-Id: Iec8f5039ae5b830836564a1a402ad3e4ba38935d
Closes-bug: #1525856

commit_message:
Fixes kvs cache key mangling issue for Py3

The dogpile sha1_key_mangler function was not safe to use with text
data. A new default key mangler was added base on the one that is
included with oslo_cache.  All of the test modules that were blocked
by this have been enabled.

bp python3

Change-Id: Id651b01a0def8c4043eebb56d7e01d62ff4251f8

subject: Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-22 17:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/resource/service_identity.pp', 'spec/defines/keystone_resource_service_identity_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/keystone_endpoint_spec.rb'], 'message': "Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default

A recent change (1] made Keystone_endpoint matching service by name/type.
This change added a warning if endpoints were not created with a default
service.
The way this new feature was added is problematic because we had
warnings by default, since all Puppet modules use this define, so it
introduced a poor user experience.

This patch makes sure a service type is configured with the new way in
the keystone::resource::service_identity function, when creating
endpoint.
For backward compatibility, when no service type is specified, we have now a
conditional that sends a warning if no service type is set but still
create the endpoints.
For the service management, it adds the service type with the new way,
so we don't have any warning by default.

So from this patch, we don't have this kind of warning by default:
/Keystone_endpoint[RegionOne/keystone]/type: Support for a endpoint
without the type set is deprecated in Liberty. It will be dropped in
Mitaka

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=0a4e06abb0f5b3f324464ff5219d2885816311ce

Closes-Bug: #1528308
Change-Id: I6e411d8f81c7ae5c768d85a236c0942d265c74dd
(cherry picked from commit 6e811badf0dc43b980ca3479e47a4a13eb9cad4b)
"}]
commit_message:
Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default

A recent change (1] made Keystone_endpoint matching service by name/type.
This change added a warning if endpoints were not created with a default
service.
The way this new feature was added is problematic because we had
warnings by default, since all Puppet modules use this define, so it
introduced a poor user experience.

This patch makes sure a service type is configured with the new way in
the keystone::resource::service_identity function, when creating
endpoint.
For backward compatibility, when no service type is specified, we have now a
conditional that sends a warning if no service type is set but still
create the endpoints.
For the service management, it adds the service type with the new way,
so we don't have any warning by default.

So from this patch, we don't have this kind of warning by default:
/Keystone_endpoint[RegionOne/keystone]/type: Support for a endpoint
without the type set is deprecated in Liberty. It will be dropped in
Mitaka

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=0a4e06abb0f5b3f324464ff5219d2885816311ce

Closes-Bug: #1528308
Change-Id: I6e411d8f81c7ae5c768d85a236c0942d265c74dd
(cherry picked from commit 6e811badf0dc43b980ca3479e47a4a13eb9cad4b)

commit_message:
Resubmit the StorPool libvirt attachment driver.

It was approved for Kilo, but the code itself was not merged;
now the StorPool volume driver will hopefully reenter Cinder, so
here is the proposal to teach Nova to actually use
the StorPool volumes.

Previously-approved: kilo

commit_message:
Prevent 'manage' from CLEANING

The state machine was modified for manual cleaning, to allow a node
to go from CLEANING to MANAGEABLE via 'manage' verb. However, this
is only for internal use when manual cleaning is finished. If a user
tries to do this via the API, we want to return an appropriate
message.

Change-Id: Ibe73c95b3c945feef4e1d2878826e6acc8d27b86
Partial-Bug: #1526290

commit_message:
Fix failure to create glance https connection pool

Due to a typo in an attribute named, an Attribute error is raised
causing failure in connection to glance through HTTPS

Urllib3 PoolManager class has a connection_pool_kw attribute
but not connection_kw

Change-Id: Id4d6a5bdcf971d09e80043fd2ab399e208fd931c
Closes-Bug: #1479020
(cherry picked from commit c41dcc9f4366429d952cc47853496d58d47b7511)

subject: yum-minimal : install selinux policy packages
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-21 21:48:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum-minimal/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'yum-minimal : install selinux policy packages

Install selinux policy packages as part of the base-installs.  selinux
is part of the base-system and the kernel boots by default in selinux
mode.

Without both of these, we can get in a situation where later scripts
(particuarly, some of the infra scripts) might install systemd-policy
without a base policy (targeted), leading to a messed up situation
where systemd will halt during boot due to missing policy files.

Change-Id: I6bf156304d1134fb328fba9b12dc364701b13696
'}]
commit_message:
yum-minimal : install selinux policy packages

Install selinux policy packages as part of the base-installs.  selinux
is part of the base-system and the kernel boots by default in selinux
mode.

Without both of these, we can get in a situation where later scripts
(particuarly, some of the infra scripts) might install systemd-policy
without a base policy (targeted), leading to a messed up situation
where systemd will halt during boot due to missing policy files.

Change-Id: I6bf156304d1134fb328fba9b12dc364701b13696

subject: yum-minimal: leave behind dummy /etc/resolv.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-21 04:29:02.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum-minimal/root.d/08-yum-chroot'], 'message': "yum-minimal: leave behind dummy /etc/resolv.conf

As described in the comment, systemd will create a broken
/etc/resolv.conf link if there is no file in the base-image (as you
can read in the bug, it is debated if this is a bug or a feature).

The solution is to leave a dummy /etc/resolv.conf file in the image.
Whatever network manager you choose (NetworkManager, glean,
cloud-config, etc) will overwrite this anyway.

It's just that some tools, such as dhclient, get confused with the
broken symlink.  This affects you if you're using glean to configure
the network in a DHCP situation, for example -- dhclient won't
configure nameservers and everything goes to heck.

Change-Id: I734834d03e7fdb13f9ab2e86f877b07bf4a84ff9
"}]
commit_message:
yum-minimal: leave behind dummy /etc/resolv.conf

As described in the comment, systemd will create a broken
/etc/resolv.conf link if there is no file in the base-image (as you
can read in the bug, it is debated if this is a bug or a feature).

The solution is to leave a dummy /etc/resolv.conf file in the image.
Whatever network manager you choose (NetworkManager, glean,
cloud-config, etc) will overwrite this anyway.

It's just that some tools, such as dhclient, get confused with the
broken symlink.  This affects you if you're using glean to configure
the network in a DHCP situation, for example -- dhclient won't
configure nameservers and everything goes to heck.

Change-Id: I734834d03e7fdb13f9ab2e86f877b07bf4a84ff9

commit_message:
Stop collecting glance services by name

Collect glance service resources by title instead of name.  The service
name differs across distributions but the resource title does not.
These collectors were silently ignored when they did not match any
services on Red Hat systems.

Change-Id: I9c17395576b35920eda1f57d93ef684a00253c53
Closes-Bug: 1511891

subject: yum-minimal: do not configure eth0 & eth1 for DHCP automatically
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-21 21:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['elements/centos-minimal/environment.d/10-centos-distro-name.bash', 'elements/yum-minimal/install.d/10-base-networking', 'elements/centos-minimal/README.rst', 'elements/yum-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': 'yum-minimal: do not configure eth0 & eth1 for DHCP automatically

Add an environment variable to control the creation of eth0/1
interface enablement scripts.

With a tool such as glean, the presence of these scripts will indicate
the interface is configured and configuration-drive settings will not
be applied.  This means in a non-dhcp situation like on Rackspace,
network is broken.

On Fedora, where later systemd provides "predictable network interface
names" [1] eth0 & eth1 ironically aren't predictable so this just
confuses things.  You really need cloud-init or glean or something to
bring up your interfaces in a sane fashion.

This maintains the status-quo on centos-minimal, but disables creation
for fedora-minimal.

[1] http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/PredictableNetworkInterfaceNames/

Change-Id: I3f1ffeb6de3b1f952292a144efab9554f7f99a5f
'}]
commit_message:
yum-minimal: do not configure eth0 & eth1 for DHCP automatically

Add an environment variable to control the creation of eth0/1
interface enablement scripts.

With a tool such as glean, the presence of these scripts will indicate
the interface is configured and configuration-drive settings will not
be applied.  This means in a non-dhcp situation like on Rackspace,
network is broken.

On Fedora, where later systemd provides "predictable network interface
names" [1] eth0 & eth1 ironically aren't predictable so this just
confuses things.  You really need cloud-init or glean or something to
bring up your interfaces in a sane fashion.

This maintains the status-quo on centos-minimal, but disables creation
for fedora-minimal.

[1] http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/PredictableNetworkInterfaceNames/

Change-Id: I3f1ffeb6de3b1f952292a144efab9554f7f99a5f

subject: Allow '_' in node interface names
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-06 17:21:22.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "Allow '_' in node interface names

To facilitate assigning arbitrary names to network interfaces,
the underlying code that creates udev rules must be modified.
Fuel agent expects mapping of MAC addresses to interface names to
be in the following format: <mac>_<ifname> and splits the entry
without limiting the number of splits. If <ifname> contains '_'
this code will produce 'ValueError: too many values to unpack' error.
This patch fixes this behaviour by limiting the number of splits to 1.

Change-Id: I6cb22af7ee79edf29dcf5aadf22d8bdceedfd2ac
"}]
commit_message:
Allow '_' in node interface names

To facilitate assigning arbitrary names to network interfaces,
the underlying code that creates udev rules must be modified.
Fuel agent expects mapping of MAC addresses to interface names to
be in the following format: <mac>_<ifname> and splits the entry
without limiting the number of splits. If <ifname> contains '_'
this code will produce 'ValueError: too many values to unpack' error.
This patch fixes this behaviour by limiting the number of splits to 1.

Change-Id: I6cb22af7ee79edf29dcf5aadf22d8bdceedfd2ac

Currently cinder v<1/2>/types API returns volume type extra specs together
with type name.  Volume type extra specs usually contains sensitive
informations such as volume backend name, detailed requirement for the type
that any deployer would want to keep from exposing to end users.

This change adds a check in DB API layer and stop returning extra specs at
all.

Change-Id: I7572a65614fb22cbcdf9ad4d768d44923e759512
Closes-bug: #1351971
"}]
commit_message:
Don't display type extra specs to non-admin

Currently cinder v<1/2>/types API returns volume type extra specs together
with type name.  Volume type extra specs usually contains sensitive
informations such as volume backend name, detailed requirement for the type
that any deployer would want to keep from exposing to end users.

This change adds a check in DB API layer and stop returning extra specs at
all.

Change-Id: I7572a65614fb22cbcdf9ad4d768d44923e759512
Closes-bug: #1351971

Currently we're using a base driver that is a composition of
12 other classes.  This was designed this way to allow the use
of ABC tagging to enforce iterface definition in drivers.

This patch tries to find a middle-ground with the nubmer of
ABC classes and inheritance and a more single inheritance model
similar to what we had before.

This patch adds a pure abstract BaseDriver class that includes
only the required methods and marks them with the abc decorator.
A driver developer should be able to look at this BaseDriver class
and know exactly what he or she is required to implement in their
driver.

The VolumeDriver is just the composition of the methods that we
offer a general implementation for, ISCSIDriver has the general
implementation of ISCSI methods and so on.

Change-Id: Ie0b3336066176454b37c7dfcb52afb828e5fb50b
"}]
commit_message:
Use a single base class for the VolumeDriver

Currently we're using a base driver that is a composition of
12 other classes.  This was designed this way to allow the use
of ABC tagging to enforce iterface definition in drivers.

This patch tries to find a middle-ground with the nubmer of
ABC classes and inheritance and a more single inheritance model
similar to what we had before.

This patch adds a pure abstract BaseDriver class that includes
only the required methods and marks them with the abc decorator.
A driver developer should be able to look at this BaseDriver class
and know exactly what he or she is required to implement in their
driver.

The VolumeDriver is just the composition of the methods that we
offer a general implementation for, ISCSIDriver has the general
implementation of ISCSI methods and so on.

Change-Id: Ie0b3336066176454b37c7dfcb52afb828e5fb50b

commit_message:
Driver get_stats refresh arg is useless

Driver get_stats refresh arg is useless. The fix tries to get rid
of this argument and helps to simplify the structure of most drivers.
Since by default manager passes refresh argument as True even though
the drivers have conditional refresh it always evaluate to True.
So cleaning it up as by default we want it to refresh always.

Change-Id: Id04400d81df44da1e93a0122328a4138810e20f6
Closes-Bug: #1423365

commit_message:
Revert "mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency"

This reverts commit e67adc385ce6997249fbf70e9402264f758fc6f4.

I'm not sure this is the right approach, why move it from requirments to setup.cfg?

A check_updtodate --checkonly test was added because
it we silently break genconfig and we should start checking
that.  The original patch tagged it on as part of pep8
checks, which is "ok" but sometimes in a test env a developer
may not want to setup the venv and run the genconfig but
rather just needs a pep8 check against their code.

If this merges, we could then add an independent job to the
gate.  I'd actually propose that we just re add the old
genconfig job and make it non-voting. This at least gives
a running confg file and will be visible if/when things
break.  Whether we do that, or keep it as a checkonly and
vote is still up for debate.

Change-Id: Ifb3f4d71f0d0ded5dfe4901203d292f0fc8d98cd
'}]
commit_message:
Move then newly added genconfig to its own testenv

A check_updtodate --checkonly test was added because
it we silently break genconfig and we should start checking
that.  The original patch tagged it on as part of pep8
checks, which is "ok" but sometimes in a test env a developer
may not want to setup the venv and run the genconfig but
rather just needs a pep8 check against their code.

If this merges, we could then add an independent job to the
gate.  I'd actually propose that we just re add the old
genconfig job and make it non-voting. This at least gives
a running confg file and will be visible if/when things
break.  Whether we do that, or keep it as a checkonly and
vote is still up for debate.

Change-Id: Ifb3f4d71f0d0ded5dfe4901203d292f0fc8d98cd

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 02:44:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/backup/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/cmd/manage.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Make RPC and objects backwards compatible

The following patch is the last part of the cinder rolling
upgrade effort.  Before the object is sent over RPC, it is
made compatible, if BACKWARD_COMPAT_MODE is true.  If the
cinder-api and cinder-scheduler were upgrade, but
cinder-volume and cinder-backup was not, it would make a
backwards compatible RPC call, using the old interface.
Once all components are upgrade, the administrator can
turn off BACKWARD_COMPAT_MODE using
"cinder-manage version upgrade".  After which, all cinder
components would be running with the latest RPC and object
versions.

Please note that the changes in this patch are a starting point.
Since all cinder internals have not been switched over to objects,
and we cannot make RPC interfaces compatible until this patch
gets merged, rolling upgrade in cinder is not supported.

Change-Id: I073383d6b237b517b14f29e4a90f50284f180219
Partial-Implements: blueprint rpc-object-compatibility
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Make RPC and objects backwards compatible

The following patch is the last part of the cinder rolling
upgrade effort.  Before the object is sent over RPC, it is
made compatible, if BACKWARD_COMPAT_MODE is true.  If the
cinder-api and cinder-scheduler were upgrade, but
cinder-volume and cinder-backup was not, it would make a
backwards compatible RPC call, using the old interface.
Once all components are upgrade, the administrator can
turn off BACKWARD_COMPAT_MODE using
"cinder-manage version upgrade".  After which, all cinder
components would be running with the latest RPC and object
versions.

Please note that the changes in this patch are a starting point.
Since all cinder internals have not been switched over to objects,
and we cannot make RPC interfaces compatible until this patch
gets merged, rolling upgrade in cinder is not supported.

Change-Id: I073383d6b237b517b14f29e4a90f50284f180219
Partial-Implements: blueprint rpc-object-compatibility

There are some barbarism located in the file cinder/HACKING.rst.
  line11 and line21 : there is no full point at the end of a sentence.
  line14 and line23 : after a sentence, there are two space between
  the full point and the first letter of the second sentence.
I think the correct format of the above question as blow.

Change-Id: I7635a2806a24130f306b144f4878e6b2d6c7fa99
Closes-Bug: #1487665
'}]
commit_message:
Fix description for "Barbarism of editting a file"

There are some barbarism located in the file cinder/HACKING.rst.
  line11 and line21 : there is no full point at the end of a sentence.
  line14 and line23 : after a sentence, there are two space between
  the full point and the first letter of the second sentence.
I think the correct format of the above question as blow.
   - [N319] Validate that debug level logs are not translated.
   - [C302] six.text_type should be used instead of unicode.
   - [N325] str() and unicode() cannot be used on
   an exception. Remove or use six.text_type().
   - [C304] Enforce no use of LOG.audit
   messages. LOG.info should be used instead.

Change-Id: I7635a2806a24130f306b144f4878e6b2d6c7fa99
Closes-Bug: #1487665

commit_message:
[WIP] Replace mox with mock

Cinder still have lots of the unit tests which are using the mox library.

Change-Id: If9669a59a8bd11029303b08409f96b42cd1d00f8
Implements: blueprint mox-to-mock-conversion

commit_message:
Allow CoW cloning of ISO images on RBD.

Avoid unnecessary downloading of ISO image from Glance when Glance
also uses Ceph/RBD.

Add policy check for volume types api

As other apis, volume types api need to authorize user's context.

Closes-Bug: #1498318

commit_message:
Implement Huawei FusionStorage driver

It uses socket and CLI to communicate with FusionStorage
to perform the following:
* Create/Delete Volume
* Extend Volume
* Create/Delete Snapshot
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Delete Volume Snapshot
* Get Volume Stats
* Clone Volume

Certification test result for Huawei FusionStorage:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1477821

Change-Id: I99c9415191021914dca2ba36a890fa768bdf786f
Implements: huawei-fusionstorage-driver

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-10-12 06:03:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/cloudbyte/cloudbyte.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cloudbyte.py'], 'message': 'Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte

Currently in CloudByte Cinder driver there is no way of checking
the "absence" or "validity" of configuration parameters, which are
configured by clients during DevStack setup against CloudByte
Storage in "cinder.conf". In this case the cinder-volume service
initializes the driver with the parameters either not present or are
invalid, and due to this several ambiguity happens at client-end, like:

* Volume related operation failure.
* No proper detection of the cause of failure.

So, to rectify this problem "check_for_setup_error" method is added
which will check the absence and validity of config parameters and
will not initialize the driver until the cause is rectified.

Also, another minor bug fixed is done which allows the volume
deletion operation to continue from OpenStack even if the volume has
been deleted from CloudByte Storage.

Change-Id: Ib30e1438a425846d4807e8a0f6daf98ec12f1d9b
Closes-Bug: #1501304
'}]
commit_message:
Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte

Currently in CloudByte Cinder driver there is no way of checking
the "absence" or "validity" of configuration parameters, which are
configured by clients during DevStack setup against CloudByte
Storage in "cinder.conf". In this case the cinder-volume service
initializes the driver with the parameters either not present or are
invalid, and due to this several ambiguity happens at client-end, like:

* Volume related operation failure.
* No proper detection of the cause of failure.

So, to rectify this problem "check_for_setup_error" method is added
which will check the absence and validity of config parameters and
will not initialize the driver until the cause is rectified.

Also, another minor bug fixed is done which allows the volume
deletion operation to continue from OpenStack even if the volume has
been deleted from CloudByte Storage.

Change-Id: Ib30e1438a425846d4807e8a0f6daf98ec12f1d9b
Closes-Bug: #1501304

Some l23network ethtool fixes

* Fix ethtool parse issues for centos/rhel
* Test coverage of l23network ethtool

Partial-bug: #1527616

Change-Id: Iddaa996d4e08db9dbc5422a2eb46ab256044bbd0

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-22 17:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/fake_vmem_client.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/violin/v7000_common.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_v7000_common.py'], 'message': 'VMEM v7000: support storage pools / volume types

In this change, the cinder driver selects a storage pool for the lun
to be created, based on the pool type and the configured pools. If the
client is connected to an external head, it is mandatory that the
following cinder conf parameters be specified:

dedup_only_pools : list of pools that are exclusively to be used for
dedup luns
dedup_capable_pools : list of pools that can support dedup in addition
to other lun types

If the user specified a storage pool using the extra_specs that pool
is used.

Change-Id: Ida5d1cb29ac6c771e994cca385ceadbf8640ed3a
Closes-Bug: #1467618
'}]
commit_message:
VMEM v7000: support storage pools / volume types

In this change, the cinder driver selects a storage pool for the lun
to be created, based on the pool type and the configured pools. If the
client is connected to an external head, it is mandatory that the
following cinder conf parameters be specified:

dedup_only_pools : list of pools that are exclusively to be used for
dedup luns
dedup_capable_pools : list of pools that can support dedup in addition
to other lun types

If the user specified a storage pool using the extra_specs that pool
is used.

Change-Id: Ida5d1cb29ac6c771e994cca385ceadbf8640ed3a
Closes-Bug: #1467618

commit_message:
Fix the bug of "spelling error of a word"

The word "occured" should be spelled as "occurred",
so it is changed.

Change-Id: I0141c53ba7324db847b77cfdea9887ce0cbf009a
Closes-Bug: #1501188

commit_message:
Prevent uploading encrypted volume to images

Currently it allows to upload encrypted volume to images,
but doesn't save encryption metadata into Glance, which
causes Glance to save the encrypted image but not the
encryption information. As a result, Nova can't use the
image.

The patch is to prevent the operation in liberty release.

APIImpact
Encrypted volumes are not allowed to upload to images.

Change-Id: Ia4e1b3ac1bedc957a2f94c888cb176d81a71f00f
Closes-bug: #1485449

commit_message:
Prevent concurrent backups for same volume

Concurrent backups possible due to dirty read when we
are getting the volume status concurrently. To avoid
this, move getting and changing volume status into db
session. Also change back the volume status if
exception happens when creating backups.

Change-Id: I2b3cdf714a74593cf49af87132c53819ca5fe05a
Closes-Bug: #1469659

commit_message:
New cinder driver to support Daowoo YeeSan

Add a cinder volume driver for Daowoo YeeSan storage. It includes the
minimum set of features. This driver introduces a new storage protocol
`yfs`, which is used in qemu and libvirt.

Implements: blueprint cinder-driver-for-yeesan
Change-Id: I6a3d2290ac326f24257af663c014596c4cf842a9
Depends-On: I3cc12f745c8db08673d45f4642d4f097b1f7ad82

commit_message:
Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

Change-Id: I08162e1657c3ec05a55289966ab6d7706370cef1
Depends-On: Ida294b05a85f5bef587b761fcd03c28c7a3474d8

Remove cinder.api.middleware.sizelimit:RequestBodySizeLimiter in favor
of oslo_middleware:RequestBodySizeLimiter. The former was left as a
compatibility shim for kilo, removing this for Mitaka since the

commit_message:
Remove cinder's RequestBodySizeLimiter

Remove cinder.api.middleware.sizelimit:RequestBodySizeLimiter in favor
of oslo_middleware:RequestBodySizeLimiter. The former was left as a
compatibility shim for kilo, removing this for Mitaka since the
operators should have already migrated to the latter.

Change-Id: I5d8c03921146697d54330d074e4ba461168eaf94
Closes-Bug: #1499921

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-27 07:07:07.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/vzstorage.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': "WIP: RemoteFS volume format handlers

Move the code, which works with image files to separate
classes, 'image format handlers'.

These classes contain methods create_volume, delete_volume,
create_snapshot e.t.c.. Methods take one extra argument in
contrast to correspoding methods in VolumeDrive - mount_point.
It's a directory, where images should be placed.

When you create a volume driver will select proper format handler
class depeding on volume_format in volume metadata, volume type
and default config parameter (<driver prefix>_default_image_format).
volume_create will update volume metadata and store volume_format
there. So in consequent operation proper class will be selected
as specified in Volume object.

This change have 3 advantages:
1. Duplicated code from remotefs driver will be removed.
2. All drivers will support all volume formats.
3. New volume formats could be added easily, including non-qcow2
   snapshots.

I want to add new volume format
https://openvz.org/Ploop/format
https://openvz.org/Ploop/Why

This format is very different from qcow2 including snapshots, so
it's not so easy to add it with current remotefs drivers design.

Most of the volume and snapshots operations work with this patch and
nfs and vzstorage drivers. There are only 8 fails in tempest.

But, please, don't check the code very carefully, because of course,
there are problems in it. I wanted to demonstrate this approach
and discuss it.

Partial-Implements: blueprint remotefs-volume-format-handlers

Change-Id: Ia2d60156e1a82801699e16b8680f52e4d1ed0def"}]
commit_message:
WIP: RemoteFS volume format handlers

Move the code, which works with image files to separate
classes, 'image format handlers'.

These classes contain methods create_volume, delete_volume,
create_snapshot e.t.c.. Methods take one extra argument in
contrast to correspoding methods in VolumeDrive - mount_point.
It's a directory, where images should be placed.

When you create a volume driver will select proper format handler
class depeding on volume_format in volume metadata, volume type
and default config parameter (<driver prefix>_default_image_format).
volume_create will update volume metadata and store volume_format
there. So in consequent operation proper class will be selected
as specified in Volume object.

This change have 3 advantages:
1. Duplicated code from remotefs driver will be removed.
2. All drivers will support all volume formats.
3. New volume formats could be added easily, including non-qcow2
   snapshots.

I want to add new volume format
https://openvz.org/Ploop/format
https://openvz.org/Ploop/Why

This format is very different from qcow2 including snapshots, so
it's not so easy to add it with current remotefs drivers design.

Most of the volume and snapshots operations work with this patch and
nfs and vzstorage drivers. There are only 8 fails in tempest.

But, please, don't check the code very carefully, because of course,
there are problems in it. I wanted to demonstrate this approach
and discuss it.

Partial-Implements: blueprint remotefs-volume-format-handlers

Change-Id: Ia2d60156e1a82801699e16b8680f52e4d1ed0def

commit_message:
Fix naming convention deviations in cinder db api

When the db model has a table named FooBar (in camel case), then the
db api methods dealing with this model element should start with the
prefix foo_bar_ (in snake case).

This convention is violated by methods dealing with ConsistencyGroup
model element where the api methods have the prefix consistencygroup_
instead of consistency_group_. Similarly, methods dealing with
VolumeTypes model element also are inconsistent since they use the
prefix volume_type_ instead of volume_types_.

These deviations make it impossible to automatically select the get
method for an ORM model.

Change-Id: Ifa7e8447d1b54d70609efe87218b4df608b5b106
Closes-Bug: #1493114

commit_message:
Fixes delete cgsnapshot to catch SnapshotIsBusy

If the driver raises SnapshotIsBusy, delete_cgsnapshot should honor
it and not place the cgsnapshot in error_deleting state. Instead,
it should keep the cgsnapshot in an available state, and simply
refuse to delete the cgsnapshot. This functionality now mirrors
delete_snapshot.

Change-Id: I39222f76f287221793d189ee5d4fe8d2fbf42704
Closes-Bug: #1488584

commit_message:
Status error after manage a volume

When we import a volume using a wrong backend,
the volume status is not 'error' but 'creating'.
This is due to a small coding error.

The parameter 'request_spec' is:
request_spec: {
	u'volume_properties': {
		u'status': u'creating',
		u'volume_type_id': None,
		u'display_name': u'liu111',
		u'availability_zone': u'nova',
		u'bootable': False,
		u'size': 0,
		u'attach_status': u'detached',
		u'display_description': None,
		u'host': u'ubuntu-204@v3r3#StoragePool001',
		u'volume_metadata': [],
		u'volume_admin_metadata': [],
		u'user_id': u'024c10bcc37142d2ab3e9ccd152ac66d',
		u'project_id': u'cddc11d599794a618ef769b8e9092f27',
		u'id': u'732953e0-8879-4a73-9af5-f96aae8ad55d',
		u'metadata': None
	},
	u'ref': {
		u'source-name': u'bc'
	},
	u'volume_type': {
		
	}
}
And there is no 'volume_id' in it.

Change-Id: I613218fbdbec9e607a920c6f5e2a9181de83165c
Closes-Bug: #1517337

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-20 03:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/targets/cxt.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_base_iscsi_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/targets/tgt.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_tgt_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/targets/iscsi.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Robustify writing iscsi target persistence file

With the current code, it's possible to end up with a zero-size
persistence file (or even corruption of the contents) if the
process gets killed or the system takes a power outage.

Switch to a "write to temp file and rename" model for writing the
persistence file.  This will make it more robust against unclean
process termination or unclean system shutdown.

Change-Id: I5e970def35c35aee22bda1cd95507781e97eeac8
Closes-Bug: #1499795
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Robustify writing iscsi target persistence file

With the current code, it's possible to end up with a zero-size
persistence file (or even corruption of the contents) if the
process gets killed or the system takes a power outage.

Switch to a "write to temp file and rename" model for writing the
persistence file.  This will make it more robust against unclean
process termination or unclean system shutdown.

Change-Id: I5e970def35c35aee22bda1cd95507781e97eeac8
Closes-Bug: #1499795

commit_message:
Cinder part of volume snapshot improvements

This patch implements blueprint assisted-snapshot-improvements

  1) Add processing to update_snapshot_status API for new fields
  2) Add new fields to the update_snapshot_status call made by Nova
  4) Add support for compatibility with pre-liberty Nova
  5) Add testcases
  6) Fixed test_glusterfs testcases that were failing due to changes
     in remotefs code by this patch
  7) Refactored _delete_snapshot_online into pre, do and post steps

Testing Info:
  1) Tested against Nova patch (see Depends-On below)
     using GlusterFS as the Cinder backend

Implements: blueprint assisted-snapshot-improvements
Depends-On: Ib5c3de6e757a8cdd098d68ca26194891458b57a9
Change-Id: Ifa2836a87271d465af61c4ae4b2018cde0698924

commit_message:
Fake driver is added to test large_ops

This driver has capabilty to add/delete volumes, sanpshots etc.
It will not create the actual volume. It will just save data
in data structure.

Change-Id: If0e42ce057266868188389ec44379204e69750a0
Closes-Bug: #1250696

commit_message:
Validate name and description string

If you pass name or description parameters with more than 255
characters to create and update apis of volume and snapshot
and create api of backup, then it returns 500 error code.

Added new method validate_name_and_description() in
cinder.api.openstack.wsgi.Controllera to validate string limit and
returned 400 if limit exceeds and also removing leading or trailing
whitespaces and string containing only whitespaces.

APIImpact
1. For all above APIs 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier it was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to 'name' parameter.
   Now it will raise 400 error if only whitespaces are passed and will
   remove leading-trailing spaces if present in other cases.

Conflicts:
	cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py
	cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_backups.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_snapshots.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py

Closes-Bug: 1454244
Change-Id: Iaf7159e816f69fd776a09828c3bc1d27fc9fdcdb
(cherry picked from commit a1bb185a1f0311c36fd590d48531ded6ccccc5c6)

commit_message:
Add extra spec capability for Nimble Cinder Driver

Supported Extra Specs are

1. Performance Policy Name
nimble:perfpol-name = <Performance Policy Name>

2. Encryption
nimble:encryption = "yes"

Implements: blueprint nimble-add-extra-specs-support

Change-Id: I45a18b189746b778f10eecbf669be7943828e28b
(cherry picked from commit 7093d0e290a6916db9eb244c187c56ebfa5b1990)

commit_message:
Fix 3PAR driver handling of existing VLUNs

Changes the 3PAR FC and iSCSI drivers to check for existing
VLUNs by taking into consideration both the volume and the host
when querying the backend.

Also pulled out some common code from the FC and iSCSI driver
to reduce duplicate code relating to the finding of existing
VLUNs.

Closes-Bug: #1475064
Change-Id: Id8fbdb5ae79274fb3d074f674df39f56db06f34d
(cherry picked from commit a07502f697fc7e45871d0099889841d03bfdf773)

commit_message:
Use of ast for integers doesn't changes type

ast.literal_eval doesn't change types for Integer
Booleans resulting in DBAPIError exceptions with
at least postgresql. Boolean columns need to be
explicitly cast to boolean types. This changes
the way filters are processed in the volume API.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ice9c57fa99c17e4c87de6362bf30ed30503a1bed
Closes-Bug: #1494475

commit_message:
Get volume from db again before updating it's status

During uploading a volume which is attached to an instance to image service,
if the instance is deleted then the volume remains in "in-use" status.
So get the volume again from db before updating it's status.

Added new db api called 'volume_update_status_based_on_attachment'.
It gets volume from db and updates its status using the same session.

Closes-Bug: #1406703
Change-Id: I01d313438f021cd2fe0d6f5c23f2029279d4b55a
(cherry picked from commit 4d6ddcb94435a20476536f4956de88ce4ab15b66)

commit_message:
adds user_id to check_is_admin

A small tactical update to allow cinder to consider user_id
when checking for admin.

This is needed in the field until the larger changes around
admin scoping are completed. Checking for role only is not
sufficient in a multi-domain configuration.

juno-backport-potential
kilo-backport-potential

closes-bug: 968696

Change-Id: I0cb99186bd833c4c32964490c4bc6da9ad42d320
(cherry picked from commit 9840721b51671296816d681dbd4b9afe221f68b4)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-10 05:57:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': "Support libgfapi's backing file path format

Currently the _qemu_img_info_base method of remotefs driver
only allows the normal format of backing file's path. If nova
enables libgfapi, the backing file's path sometimes is looking
like this: gluster://<hostname/ip>:port/<volume_path>. And it
is not recognized by the driver. This patch is going to address
the issue.

Change-Id: I702ee1c92e0851869d3f9c4f0c65c8526cd39771
Closes-Bug: #1514691
"}]
commit_message:
Support libgfapi's backing file path format

Currently the _qemu_img_info_base method of remotefs driver
only allows the normal format of backing file's path. If nova
enables libgfapi, the backing file's path sometimes is looking
like this: gluster://<hostname/ip>:port/<volume_path>. And it
is not recognized by the driver. This patch is going to address
the issue.

Change-Id: I702ee1c92e0851869d3f9c4f0c65c8526cd39771
Closes-Bug: #1514691

commit_message:
NetApp: Refactor E-Series tests

Refactor the unittests for the NetApp E-Series drivers, removing
any functional tests and relocating tests underneath the
the path where the rest of the tests live.

Improve the coverage against the Fibre Channel E-Series driver
by refactoring the iSCSI tests to work generically where possible.

Change-Id: I30082859242cb5bc8d607ea2a6684a41f863b611

subject: Support new ironic "enroll" state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-22 11:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/fakes.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Support new ironic "enroll" state

This state was introduced in Liberty as a new state for freshly
enrolled node. Transition from it is done by the same verb "manage",
but now involves validation of power credentials. Nodes are not set to
"available" if they fail introspection or power credentials.

The code changes required some additional changes to test and utility
code, as follows:

 - utils.wait_for_provision_state now raises appropriate exceptions on
   error rather than returning False
 - there's now a utils.nodes_in_states function to list baremetal nodes
   in a given set of states.
 - logic is added to baremetal/fakes.py to track states of fake nodes;
   this is much simpler and less brittle than precisely mocking the
   results of API calls in exactly the order the library code makes
   them.
 - bulk introspection tests consistently mock at the client layer,
   rather than at a variety of layers.
 - timeout and power-credential error during bulk introspection are
   tested.

Change-Id: I4da61491f60f7ebd42ca1f8fe45c3d4df6e49887
Co-Authored-By: Miles Gould <mgould@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support new ironic "enroll" state

This state was introduced in Liberty as a new state for freshly
enrolled node. Transition from it is done by the same verb "manage",
but now involves validation of power credentials. Nodes are not set to
"available" if they fail introspection or power credentials.

The code changes required some additional changes to test and utility
code, as follows:

 - utils.wait_for_provision_state now raises appropriate exceptions on
   error rather than returning False
 - there's now a utils.nodes_in_states function to list baremetal nodes
   in a given set of states.
 - logic is added to baremetal/fakes.py to track states of fake nodes;
   this is much simpler and less brittle than precisely mocking the
   results of API calls in exactly the order the library code makes
   them.
 - bulk introspection tests consistently mock at the client layer,
   rather than at a variety of layers.
 - timeout and power-credential error during bulk introspection are
   tested.

Change-Id: I4da61491f60f7ebd42ca1f8fe45c3d4df6e49887
Co-Authored-By: Miles Gould <mgould@redhat.com>

subject: zmq: Don't log error when can't import zmq module
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-22 09:16:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/zmq_async.py'], 'message': 'zmq: Don't log error when can't import zmq module

Method import_zmq returns None if can't import zmq module.
For runtime code, an ImportError is raised, and for tests,
a skip message "zmq not available" is sent, so it's unnecessary
to log error which shows up in other projects' unit test logs.

Co-Authored-By: Oleksii Zamiatin <ozamiatin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Iebf15042f45da56eb633a0a70822c487dc72c884
Closes-Bug: #1528415
'}]
commit_message:
zmq: Don't log error when can't import zmq module

Method import_zmq returns None if can't import zmq module.
For runtime code, an ImportError is raised, and for tests,
a skip message "zmq not available" is sent, so it's unnecessary
to log error which shows up in other projects' unit test logs.

Co-Authored-By: Oleksii Zamiatin <ozamiatin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Iebf15042f45da56eb633a0a70822c487dc72c884
Closes-Bug: #1528415

The current scenario tests were not waiting for the load balancer to become
ACTIVE while doing cleanups causing test failures.

Also, this increases a hardcoded timeout value of when a load balancer is
deemed to be stuck.  It was too short for the gate and the nested VMs issue of
boot taking 5-8 minutes.  I've increased it to 10 minutes.

A timeout was also needed when testing connectivity to a VIP because the
default timeout is way too long.

Change-Id: I667af547296ac707a6176d5c400ce025366e65ba
"}]
commit_message:
Fix scenario tests for octavia driver

The current scenario tests were not waiting for the load balancer to become
ACTIVE while doing cleanups causing test failures.

Also, this increases a hardcoded timeout value of when a load balancer is
deemed to be stuck.  It was too short for the gate and the nested VMs issue of
boot taking 5-8 minutes.  I've increased it to 10 minutes.

A timeout was also needed when testing connectivity to a VIP because the
default timeout is way too long.

Change-Id: I667af547296ac707a6176d5c400ce025366e65ba

commit_message:
Fix python 3.x import issues with pure.py

The older import was not compatible with python 3.x, only 2.x. A simple
fix is to adjust how we are importing the module.

Change-Id: Ic1d69c676af1adde9bd305431338c16a058fccf6
Closes-Bug: 1527755

revisions:

Change-Id: I2963914e2e0744410267b5735ff77939413916d4

commit_message:
Fix image-download to stdout on Python 3.x

Glance image-download to stdout fails on Python3 due to sys.stdout.write
not allowing bytes to be written directly.

A good description of the issue is listed at http://bugs.python.org/issue18512

Closes-Bug: #1528083

Change-Id: I2963914e2e0744410267b5735ff77939413916d4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 20:24:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use branch-specific tox dir

Change the envdir used to build an env for unit
tests, to better support working on multiple
branches from the same base git dir.

This moves the tox environment into a directory
called "mitaka", so that the files used for
the mitaka tox env don't overlap with those used
for liberty.  The dir name should be bumped for
each release cycle.

This makes it possible to switch between branches
which have conflicting dependencies in the tox
env and have tox test commands work as expected.

Change-Id: I76e57db089e3258ca71863fdf6c9bdc324197975
'}]
commit_message:
Use branch-specific tox dir

Change the envdir used to build an env for unit
tests, to better support working on multiple
branches from the same base git dir.

This moves the tox environment into a directory
called "mitaka", so that the files used for
the mitaka tox env don't overlap with those used
for liberty.  The dir name should be bumped for
each release cycle.

This makes it possible to switch between branches
which have conflicting dependencies in the tox
env and have tox test commands work as expected.

Change-Id: I76e57db089e3258ca71863fdf6c9bdc324197975

commit_message:
Make kubernetes API client generic

Make kubernetes API client generic. Right now each k8s object has
a way to create k8s API client. This was needed to make sure the
tests passed. Now since all the objects-from-bay patches are merged
in its better to make the client creation logic generic.

Change-Id: Ic2a9b16bbd4c13794c7ef95309bd260366ec872e
Closes-Bug: #1502367

If Facter version used is < 3 then it adds the netmask6 facts as custom facts.

commit_message:
Adds IPv6 support for interface_for_ip function

Proper interface matching when an IPv6 address is provided.

If Facter version used is < 3 then it adds the netmask6 facts as custom facts.

Fix bugs https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1280523

Change-Id: Ide26ca1740dc12ea5f47a28f4cecacd6ef0b18f9

commit_message:
Create indirection API for versioned objects

To make full use of versioned objects we need to enable RPC calls
using them. This is role of indirection API.

blueprint indirection-api

Change-Id: I95f6bfaf9f4a33bf805ef82ddb5244d8662f1009

multirack feature.

subject: Make class action calls use version manifest
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-20 18:08:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py'], 'message': 'Make class action calls use version manifest

This follows the object_backport_versions() change by also making the
class action calls pass a version manifest. This is done in a compatible
way by first trying the new method, and if unsupported, falling back
to the original method.

No tests are changed here specifically to demonstrate that they are
undisturbed by this change. Proper tests are next.

Change-Id: If9a158fbd345b56b26ebbe2a0733db55f4929ea1
'}]
commit_message:
Make class action calls use version manifest

This follows the object_backport_versions() change by also making the
class action calls pass a version manifest. This is done in a compatible
way by first trying the new method, and if unsupported, falling back
to the original method.

No tests are changed here specifically to demonstrate that they are
undisturbed by this change. Proper tests are next.

commit_message:
Disable suggestion of v1 help for v2 commands

Currently the client suggests 'Run `glance --os-image-api-version 1
help` for v1 help' at the end of every help message. This is could
be confusing for a v2 only command.

Therefore this patch disables it if the command does not exist in v1,
while keeping the message on the 'glance help' results.

Change-Id: I967e9ba35afb8dc40524bd1d13284e684b435f81
Closes-Bug: 1520602

This adds the volume object to the parameters that are passed
to driver manage_existing_snapshot APIs. This allows for more
information about the potential parent volume of the snapshot
to be compared against.

Some drivers may not want a snapshot to be managable to a volume
if the status of the volume is in certain states, such as
the 'failed-over' state from replication. The volume object
contains the status. Also it allows verification that the volume
is the correct parent for the snapshot as some drivers may want
snapshots to only be manageable by the correct parent volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1528354
Change-Id: I67950c8867bc0a4d19263baa7c12cf99ae046d84
"}]
commit_message:
Adding volume object to manage snapshot API

This adds the volume object to the parameters that are passed
to driver manage_existing_snapshot APIs. This allows for more
information about the potential parent volume of the snapshot
to be compared against.

Some drivers may not want a snapshot to be managable to a volume
if the status of the volume is in certain states, such as
the 'failed-over' state from replication. The volume object
contains the status. Also it allows verification that the volume
is the correct parent for the snapshot as some drivers may want
snapshots to only be manageable by the correct parent volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1528354
Change-Id: I67950c8867bc0a4d19263baa7c12cf99ae046d84

commit_message:
Adapt iPXE template to work with UEFI

This patch is adapting the iPXE template to work with BIOS and UEFI
mode.

It's passing the boot_mode= kernel parameter accordingly to the mode
being booted and explicitly passing initrd=deploy_ramdisk because it's
required for iPXE with UEFI [0]

[0] http://forum.ipxe.org/showthread.php?tid=7589&pid=11843#pid11843

Change-Id: I174536a04ff3f0266e9e7eee909ad752d44c0bce
Closes-Bug: #1525989

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-12-22 15:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Show fake raid devices in Fuel UI

In order to allow nailgun-agent find out fake raid devices:
* MD with 'Raid Level' set to 'container' need to be found,
* undelaying devices from that MD should be filtered out from
  storage devices.

So, if /dev/md127 exists and is actually a contaner, then
* nailgun agent should skip it from reporting as container
  device can't be used as a block device,
* underlaying devices from that container (say, /dev/sda and /dev/sdb)
  shouldn't be reported as storage devices. Logic is simple,
  those devices can't be used too, as they're a part of MD.
* only actual MD (say, /dev/md126) which represent fake raid
  will be reported as a storage device.

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa
Co-Authored-By: Serhii Lystopad <slystopad@mirantis.com>
Related-Bug: #1508908
"}]
commit_message:
Show fake raid devices in Fuel UI

In order to allow nailgun-agent find out fake raid devices:
* MD with 'Raid Level' set to 'container' need to be found,
* undelaying devices from that MD should be filtered out from
  storage devices.

So, if /dev/md127 exists and is actually a contaner, then
* nailgun agent should skip it from reporting as container
  device can't be used as a block device,
* underlaying devices from that container (say, /dev/sda and /dev/sdb)
  shouldn't be reported as storage devices. Logic is simple,
  those devices can't be used too, as they're a part of MD.
* only actual MD (say, /dev/md126) which represent fake raid
  will be reported as a storage device.

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa
Co-Authored-By: Serhii Lystopad <slystopad@mirantis.com>
Related-Bug: #1508908

fixture in oslo timeutils that handle all of this for us.

Also replace a few occurances where timeutils.utcnow() was mocked just

commit_message:
Use TimeFixture from oslo_utils to override time in tests

Instead of calling timeutils.set_time_override() directly where one
also has to remember to call timeutils.clear_time_override() when done
or potentially interfere with other tests, lets use the provided
fixture in oslo timeutils that handle all of this for us.

Also replace a few occurances where timeutils.utcnow() was mocked just
to provide some consistency in how time overrides are done.

Change-Id: Ice5bdb3fa3dc57ba8bafba702f2070fba7457ea7

This change adds a SoftwareConfigTransport parameter to role templates
so that the transport can be changed via a parameter_defaults entry.

Changing the transport to POLL_TEMP_URL on an existing overcloud has

I9c475f0c489c67db5895924050186228403f2773 is running on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I5c2a2d2170714093c5757282cba12ac65f8738a4
'}]
commit_message:
Add SoftwareConfigTransport for switching transports

This change adds a SoftwareConfigTransport parameter to role templates
so that the transport can be changed via a parameter_defaults entry.

Changing the transport to POLL_TEMP_URL on an existing overcloud has
worked for local testing when heat change
I9c475f0c489c67db5895924050186228403f2773 is running on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I5c2a2d2170714093c5757282cba12ac65f8738a4

commit_message:
Change status to DISABLED if admin_state_up if false

If a resource's admin_state_up is false, the status should be DISABLED.
This patch changes pool, vip, member, health_monitor all together.

Change-Id: I659a0b5ee602edcf18584c55f94ceca2b886224f
Closes-Bug: #1519664

subject: Errors in docker registry configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 02:52:34.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-docker-registry.sh'], 'message': "Errors in docker registry configuration

1. Add a colon after version. It is a syntax error.
2. Correct the name of docker registry config file.
3. Add double quotation marks around string parameters. If we don't
add them and the string is composed of numbers, docker registry
reports errors.

[1]https://github.com/docker/distribution/blob/master/docs/
configuration.md#overriding-the-entire-configuration-file

Closes-Bug: #1528075
Change-Id: I2001415bc54becdccc7d28592a025c3786187fb3
"}]
commit_message:
Errors in docker registry configuration

1. Add a colon after version. It is a syntax error.
2. Correct the name of docker registry config file.
3. Add double quotation marks around string parameters. If we don't
add them and the string is composed of numbers, docker registry
reports errors.

[1]https://github.com/docker/distribution/blob/master/docs/
configuration.md#overriding-the-entire-configuration-file

Closes-Bug: #1528075
Change-Id: I2001415bc54becdccc7d28592a025c3786187fb3

commit_message:
Add -constraints sections for CI jobs

Tox does not currently support using factors with sections, and work
towards enabling this has stalled, as such we will need to duplicate
sections adding -constraints to facilitate running sections with the
constrained install_command.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Depends-On: I59fcf763d7eb9252e950dce5783befc20b4e8fd4
Change-Id: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit a42e53a8a7a9aacbfffbcfb2c3b9a606487d438b)

subject: Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-22 15:21:43.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/resource/service_identity.pp', 'spec/defines/keystone_resource_service_identity_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/keystone_endpoint_spec.rb'], 'message': "Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default

A recent change (1] made Keystone_endpoint matching service by name/type.
This change added a warning if endpoints were not created with a default
service.
The way this new feature was added is problematic because we had
warnings by default, since all Puppet modules use this define, so it
introduced a poor user experience.

This patch makes sure a service type is configured with the new way in
the keystone::resource::service_identity function, when creating
endpoint.
For backward compatibility, when no service type is specified, we have now a
conditional that sends a warning if no service type is set but still
create the endpoints.
For the service management, it adds the service type with the new way,
so we don't have any warning by default.

So from this patch, we don't have this kind of warning by default:
/Keystone_endpoint[RegionOne/keystone]/type: Support for a endpoint
without the type set is deprecated in Liberty. It will be dropped in
Mitaka

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=0a4e06abb0f5b3f324464ff5219d2885816311ce

Closes-Bug: #1528308
Change-Id: I6e411d8f81c7ae5c768d85a236c0942d265c74dd
"}]
commit_message:
Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default

A recent change (1] made Keystone_endpoint matching service by name/type.
This change added a warning if endpoints were not created with a default
service.
The way this new feature was added is problematic because we had
warnings by default, since all Puppet modules use this define, so it
introduced a poor user experience.

This patch makes sure a service type is configured with the new way in
the keystone::resource::service_identity function, when creating
endpoint.
For backward compatibility, when no service type is specified, we have now a
conditional that sends a warning if no service type is set but still
create the endpoints.
For the service management, it adds the service type with the new way,
so we don't have any warning by default.

So from this patch, we don't have this kind of warning by default:
/Keystone_endpoint[RegionOne/keystone]/type: Support for a endpoint
without the type set is deprecated in Liberty. It will be dropped in
Mitaka

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=0a4e06abb0f5b3f324464ff5219d2885816311ce

Closes-Bug: #1528308
Change-Id: I6e411d8f81c7ae5c768d85a236c0942d265c74dd

commit_message:
Align python requirements with centos repo

* add a test for requirements.txt
* fix imports for oslo_config and oslo_serialization
* pin minimal version of oslo.config and oslo.serialization
* update packages rules and specs

Change-Id: I4f1caca22fb4de3350fdbf28dae3fffe8d88326c
Closes-Bug: #1481297

commit_message:
Syntax changes for use of pip_install

Syntax changes for consistency as follows:
- Change parameter=value syntax to parameter: value in
pip_install.yml
- Change "== false" to "| bool == false", also for
consistency.

Change-Id: I728b44243910c7c5556df529e1a3291655903883

used default TFTP method.

commit_message:
Generate puppet-openstack ci docs

Puppet-Openstack ci now has docs. They are valuable
for those seting up a third-party ci system, so let's
generate them as non-voting. A follow-up patch with
publish them to http://docs.openstack.org/infra/

Change-Id: Ibf97875867438a7dd2ba9b0dae816bbd121a3e8c

commit_message:
Add a compute API to trigger crash dump in instance.

This patch adds a new API named trigger_crash_dump() to nova compute.
It calls driver.inject_nmi() to inject an NMI into the instance. And
if the instance OS is configured to use NMI to trigger kernel crash
dump, this API could trigger instance crash dump.

Change-Id: I9b649aafba011d537e3fe4eebef7a678ff6733e4
Implements: blueprint instance-crash-dump
Co-Authored-By: Hironori Shiina <shiina.hironori@jp.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Add parsing of Parteds with partitions

Implemented just a basic parsing with adapter objects to do
not pollute original objects with things that are specific for
driver/parser.
Split dynamic parser into smaller files (together with tests).

Change-Id: Ia830b0861e3a7eabb3cbfee8ebb0fe4d49cb15de
Implements: blueprint volume-manager-refactoring

commit_message:
Validating user defined partition schema

PartitionSchemaValidator validates user-provided data by using
jsonschema also provided in this commit.

Other checks include:
 - device existence and duplication
 - defining volume groups on existing pvs
 - not reusing pvs
 - defining logical volumes on existing volume groups

Change-Id: I28e3ffe053c975f37323c1e43bcbe357eeeecf1a
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Kalinowski <skalinowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sylwester Brzęczkowski <sbrzeczkowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kwiek <mkwiek@mirantis.com>

Bind fragment of haproxy configuration generator acts weird if given
multiple addresses instead of one. For instance, ['192.0.2.111',
'192.0.2.205'] and port 10000 would result it
'bind 192.0.2.111192.0.2.205:10000' when you expected two lines:
  bind 192.0.2.111:10000

Change-Id: I0def209c0f1c9ed14e70e28cf926dc61c1a704a1
Closes-Bug: #1522589
"}]
commit_message:
Allow multihomed configuration for haproxy

Bind fragment of haproxy configuration generator acts weird if given
multiple addresses instead of one. For instance, ['192.0.2.111',
'192.0.2.205'] and port 10000 would result it
'bind 192.0.2.111192.0.2.205:10000' when you expected two lines:
  bind 192.0.2.111:10000
  bind 192.0.2.205:10000

Change-Id: I0def209c0f1c9ed14e70e28cf926dc61c1a704a1
Closes-Bug: #1522589

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-22 09:32:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': "tripleo.sh add option to delete overcloud

One thing we're lacking CI coverage of atm is deleting an overcloud
and proving the delete actually works, which is proving unreliable
for some users.  First step to fixing that is having tripleo.sh
support deleting an overcloud via heat, then polling until it's
done.

Change-Id: If2e1777ec4363788c0df401c3bb470254ca78a33
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo.sh add option to delete overcloud

One thing we're lacking CI coverage of atm is deleting an overcloud
and proving the delete actually works, which is proving unreliable
for some users.  First step to fixing that is having tripleo.sh
support deleting an overcloud via heat, then polling until it's
done.

Change-Id: If2e1777ec4363788c0df401c3bb470254ca78a33

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-09 22:51:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/objects/volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Add validation for volume_type of volume object

During copy_volume_to_image(), this tries to return
volume['volume_type'] attribute in a volume object, but
if the volume does not have a volume type, this would
trigger a db call which raise an 404 not found error.

Volume object should check volume_type_id at first and
then decide whether returning volume_type or None to
avoid VolumeTypeNotFound exception.

Also this change includes LOG.info messages fix to show
right behavior of copy_volume_to_image().

Change-Id: Id2372621962406282eece2bcbc56c242f9dff8a0
Closes-Bug: #1523362
"}]
commit_message:
Add validation for volume_type of volume object

During copy_volume_to_image(), this tries to return
volume['volume_type'] attribute in a volume object, but
if the volume does not have a volume type, this would
trigger a db call which raise an 404 not found error.

Volume object should check volume_type_id at first and
then decide whether returning volume_type or None to
avoid VolumeTypeNotFound exception.

Also this change includes LOG.info messages fix to show
right behavior of copy_volume_to_image().

Change-Id: Id2372621962406282eece2bcbc56c242f9dff8a0
Closes-Bug: #1523362

default libvirt network.  This is useful so that all traffic does not

Change-Id: Iff44f44d9338b354606e9e0921d6efae763702f5

commit_message:
Optionally attach baremetal vm's to the default network

Adds an option to connect the vm's for the baremetal nodes to the
default libvirt network.  This is useful so that all traffic does not
have to be routed through the seed vm. That's desirable when testing
package based updates on the deployed baremetal nodes.

Change-Id: Iff44f44d9338b354606e9e0921d6efae763702f5

commit_message:
Add volume_extensions:quotas:delete to policy.json

Aformentioned entry was missing from default policy.json file, so the
call wasn't blocked for non-admin user. It was failing on Keystone
connection and resulted in 500 HTTP error. This addition fixes the
issue.

Closes-Bug: 1526839
Change-Id: Ib26670ea60b3e9193d91183aee35cd8aaf733068

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: I966264e04fbe9441d90c48645df5e6216ca0f4d5
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Introduce a bit more flexibility by replacing .sort() -> sorted()

This will make the change in python-keystoneclient (for the sake of
displaying lots of LDAP users in Horizon, see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/250473/4/keystoneclient/base.py) more
elegant.

Change-Id: I5857929dc86950c2321c29250ffe58bbb67f3b73
Closes-Bug: #1520668

subject: Clarify our use of Text(length) and explicitly restrict it to mysql
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 10:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/db/migration/alembic_migration/versions/25aeae45d4ad_add_task.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py', 'midonet/neutron/db/task_db.py'], 'message': "Clarify our use of Text(length) and explicitly restrict it to mysql

Specify Text length only for mysql.  Add a comment to explain
why we specify this long length.

SQLAlchemy mysql dialect uses the length argument of Text() to
choose a backing type.  (TEXT, LONGTEXT, ...)
However Text() usually doesn't need the length argument and
some dialects (eg. postgresql) bail out with errors when it's given.

Also, remove the length argument from the model because it doesn't
serve any purposes.  This allows us to remove a workaround in test.

Reference: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/type_basics.html#sqlalchemy.types.Text

Change-Id: I78ae899df080a7aa1bb78ed75d8e43a9bf75103e
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify our use of Text(length) and explicitly restrict it to mysql

Specify Text length only for mysql.  Add a comment to explain
why we specify this long length.

SQLAlchemy mysql dialect uses the length argument of Text() to
choose a backing type.  (TEXT, LONGTEXT, ...)
However Text() usually doesn't need the length argument and
some dialects (eg. postgresql) bail out with errors when it's given.

Also, remove the length argument from the model because it doesn't
serve any purposes.  This allows us to remove a workaround in test.

Reference: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/type_basics.html#sqlalchemy.types.Text

Change-Id: I78ae899df080a7aa1bb78ed75d8e43a9bf75103e

commit_message:

The test is added to the unit test environment, since we do not
have a functional test job for this repo.

This test will ensure that DB migrations and models stay in sync.

commit_message:
Make ./stack.sh optional

Create a new VAGRANT_KURYR_RUN_DEVSTACK environment variable to make the
`stack.sh` call optional.

Some people may want to edit the `local.conf` file before run `stack.sh`
manually in the VM. Useful for the devstack/plugin.sh development, for
instance.

It is defaulted to `true` for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia3fe8cb4416a75a3ec05cbb9ce698313daa555e4

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 16:12:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/neutron_router.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_router/neutron.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/neutron_router/neutron_spec.rb'], 'message': "Add 'ha' parameter for neutron_router

Change-Id: I74a5e8482b5e0019e101f78ee9eafb964cf57810
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'ha' parameter for neutron_router

'ha' parameter allows user to set the router's type to HA or not.
If this parameter is not specified, neutron will use default value, which
depends on whether L3 HA is enabled or not.

Change-Id: I74a5e8482b5e0019e101f78ee9eafb964cf57810

If L2 population driver is configured along with with vlan segmentation,

should not. L2 population mech driver should be disabled along with

Closes-bug: #1527601

commit_message:
Enable l2population driver only when l2population is enabled

If L2 population driver is configured along with with vlan segmentation,
many port-specific processing goes through l2pop mechanism driver, while it
should not. L2 population mech driver should be disabled along with
L2 population itself.

Change-Id: I0c2122a25bd967486412e50c10f18c12ddafddc0
Closes-bug: #1527601

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 17:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/request.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_request.py'], 'message': "Make pci_alias parsing logic not assume device_type is set

device_type is not a required field (and it won't match a device if
it's not also set on the corresponding whitelist entries), so don't
fail with a key error if it was not set on the alias spec.

Realated-blueprint: sriov-physical-function-passthrough
Change-Id: If4cf77a5902dc063c460532020e9bee32348e765
"}]
commit_message:
Make pci_alias parsing logic not assume device_type is set

device_type is not a required field (and it won't match a device if
it's not also set on the corresponding whitelist entries), so don't
fail with a key error if it was not set on the alias spec.

Realated-blueprint: sriov-physical-function-passthrough
Change-Id: If4cf77a5902dc063c460532020e9bee32348e765

commit_message:
Add Astara mitaka deliverables

Astara is a non:release-managed project. We just cut our m-1
tags across the 4 Astara repositories.  This adds new deliverable
files that records those as per [1].

Patches to remove version from setup.py as follows:

    * astara: https://review.openstack.org/255033
    * astara-appliance: https://review.openstack.org/255034
    * astara-horizon: https://review.openstack.org/255035
    * astara-neutron: https://review.openstack.org/255036

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/081431.html

Depends-On: Ie4a99316e60ca382f8d6323720f92ffb6642b66c
Change-Id: I52cd0e7583d224cf99922845f947824179debe7b

commit_message:
avoid metric join on resource delete

metrics on resource delete are marked as status=delete for removal
later. because of this, we don't really need to pull in metrics
when deleting resource.

Change-Id: Id083cade79c803ad291e5cf7ad966b57aa56413a

subject: Move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 07:10:13.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'ReleaseNotes'], 'message': 'Move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst

For now, we have added reno for release notes management, and a folder
"releasenotes" was added in aodh. Because there is a file named
"ReleaseNotes" to provide release note location and aodh home, it will
broken some git operations in case insensitive OS (e.g. Windows).
This change simply move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst to avoid
the problem.

Change-Id: I30ea4a5d8cb4450ca76ec5e834ccf07cd996de77
'}]
commit_message:
Move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst

For now, we have added reno for release notes management, and a folder
"releasenotes" was added in aodh. Because there is a file named
"ReleaseNotes" to provide release note location and aodh home, it will
broken some git operations in case insensitive OS (e.g. Windows).
This change simply move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst to avoid
the problem.

Change-Id: I30ea4a5d8cb4450ca76ec5e834ccf07cd996de77

commit_message:
Add hacking rules for CLI import

In order to make Rally as a Service, rally CLI modules do not
allow to work with rally.common.db and rally.common.objects.

This patch add hacking rule to check the import of CLI module.

Change-Id: I31b53567902010182a30fc139308d17beb30bc38

subject: Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-12-16 05:36:41.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/subnet.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/neutron/test_neutron_subnet.py'], 'message': "Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff

Current logic calls 'update_subnet' irrespective of any
change in properties(prop_diff). Also, don't send all properties
in json_snippet. Only send the ones in prop_diff. This fixes the
issue of subnet not being updated when update_allowed properties
are removed from the updated template.

Change-Id: I2f4f21765349d1cfffcddcb8539233ee6d8ceee9
Partial-Bug: #1521836
"}]
commit_message:
Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff

Current logic calls 'update_subnet' irrespective of any
change in properties(prop_diff). Also, don't send all properties
in json_snippet. Only send the ones in prop_diff. This fixes the
issue of subnet not being updated when update_allowed properties
are removed from the updated template.

Change-Id: I2f4f21765349d1cfffcddcb8539233ee6d8ceee9
Partial-Bug: #1521836

commit_message:
ROM firmware is optional now

ROM firmware is optional now and should be used only by user choice.
It should be named as 'FirmwareName.isarom' placed under 'drivers/' directory.
In the same directory placed an example firmware and some information.

Change-Id: I5841deacacacf39c9c654828c44a869ef996044b
Depends-On: Id1f0d9e32487bcd902940311ed8d8bef4129fdaf
Doc-Impact: ops-guide
Closes-Bug: 1528186
Closes-Bug: 1527474

commit_message:
Add attached_volume field

In oder to connect volumes that are attached to vms
the nova field os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached is needed.
This can be useful to create policy to audit if a certain
VMs uses the right volume_types/cinder AZs.

Change-Id: Ia39871a51f433342fa2364466e5f201f2a30b7f3

commit_message:
Stop passing attr to keystoneclient when there's no filter_value

It was dropping warnings like "UserWarning: Providing attr without
filter_value to get_urls() is deprecated as of the 1.7.0 release and may
be removed in the 2.0.0 release. Either both should be provided or
neither should be provided."

Change-Id: Iead0bcf36b4a46bf465a55a33a21fd7f14f0ac40

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-17 18:08:39.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/volume/base/base_qos_client.py', 'tempest/api/volume/base.py'], 'message': 'Make volume_qos_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes volume_qos_client  use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I28d6a86b9986e3d281e358dfe4a925d8ed8c5f21
'}]
commit_message:
Make volume_qos_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes volume_qos_client  use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I28d6a86b9986e3d281e358dfe4a925d8ed8c5f21

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-14 17:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'This change adds the Astara Neutron driver repo.

The Astara Neutron repo contains the drivers and plugins necessary to
load into Neutron to interface with the Astara RPC API.  This repo is
being placed under Astara after considering the list conversation
regarding the Neutron Stadium [1].  Since our team will be handling
responsibility for release activities it made since to place it here.

Change-Id: Ie4a99316e60ca382f8d6323720f92ffb6642b66c

commit_message:
This change adds the Astara Neutron driver repo.

The Astara Neutron repo contains the drivers and plugins necessary to
load into Neutron to interface with the Astara RPC API.  This repo is
being placed under Astara after considering the list conversation
regarding the Neutron Stadium [1].  Since our team will be handling
responsibility for release activities it made since to place it here.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/080865.html

Change-Id: Ie4a99316e60ca382f8d6323720f92ffb6642b66c

commit_message:
Fix 'release' and 'state_set' for UPDATE action

Remove redundant update and notification when releasing lock
for UPDATE.

Also make sure that 'state_set' calls _persist_state for UPDATE
action as this is used in 'set_stack_and_resource_to_failed',
to set the stack status to FAILED.

Co-Authored-By: Rabi Mishra <ramishra@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8a80e329604fdec6498acca0a71723100d412384
Closes-Bug: #1523717
Closes-Bug: #1516090
(cherry picked from commit e1d0b6c04112eeba2bcc02ad3ba123539a81aff7
and 411360f7d130a7639bf01954eef71c8bf7d097fa)

commit_message:
Output traceback only when debug mode is turned on

Debug mode is turned on when a user passes --debug option. Output
traceback only when debug mode is turned on, otherwise, display
information where and how bug report could be reported.

Change-Id: Iba8b40a7bb72f9ddab363b17dde7a19b1a76a520
Closes-bug: #1507948
