revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-12-21 18:06:09.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/node_group.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_groups.py'], 'message': 'Add gateways everywhere when new node group is added

It is required for environments with multiple node groups.
Before, user should set gateways for all networks via API.
Otherwise, he had got an error.

Now, it is done automatically on node group creation:
1. Set gateways for all networks in new node group.
2. Set gateways for networks in default node group where they were not set.

IP ranges of networks of default node group are cut or deleted if they
intersect with new gateways. IP addresses which intersect with new gateways
are deleted as well. Need to add appropriate message on UI when new node
group is being added.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1517400
Partial-Bug: #1484008

Change-Id: I6580d97b849ccd991bbfb65308aa35f217f30987
'}]
commit_message:
Add gateways everywhere when new node group is added

It is required for environments with multiple node groups.
Before, user should set gateways for all networks via API.
Otherwise, he had got an error.

Now, it is done automatically on node group creation:
1. Set gateways for all networks in new node group.
2. Set gateways for networks in default node group where they were not set.

IP ranges of networks of default node group are cut or deleted if they
intersect with new gateways. IP addresses which intersect with new gateways
are deleted as well. Need to add appropriate message on UI when new node
group is being added.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1517400
Partial-Bug: #1484008

Change-Id: I6580d97b849ccd991bbfb65308aa35f217f30987

Use existing config file instead of overwrite it.
Adjust sequence of command execution on docker-upgrade:
1. stop containers (supervisor)
2. deploy new docker
3. generate new configs and switch to using them
4. start containers (supervisor)

Change-Id: Iee4677c3586aba8091fe3fbb131571161e0663a1
Closes-Bug: #1433046
'}]
commit_message:
Supervisor configs are not overwritten on upgrade

Use existing config file instead of overwrite it.
Adjust sequence of command execution on docker-upgrade:
1. stop containers (supervisor)
2. deploy new docker
3. generate new configs and switch to using them
4. start containers (supervisor)

Change-Id: Iee4677c3586aba8091fe3fbb131571161e0663a1
Closes-Bug: #1433046

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-12 10:06:34.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/unique_node_iface_names.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/sqlalchemy/models/node.py'], 'message': 'Ensure node interface names are unique within node

Add a constraint on interface names that ensures that they are unique
within node. Make it deferrable so that chain renaming is possible
(e.g. (0, eth0) > (0, eth1); (1, eth1) > (1, eth0))

Change-Id: I32da84e8e83dfec12fd9facd7e3fb6094b93481f
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure node interface names are unique within node

Add a constraint on interface names that ensures that they are unique
within node. Make it deferrable so that chain renaming is possible
(e.g. (0, eth0) > (0, eth1); (1, eth1) > (1, eth0))

Change-Id: I32da84e8e83dfec12fd9facd7e3fb6094b93481f

commit_message:
Fix dependencies for Nuage plugin configuration

Specify proper dependencies between the configuration steps
required to setup the Nuage Neutron Plugin. This ensures
that the steps are executed in proper order and the plugin
is setup correctly.

Change-Id: Ib524046be71623b2d4bce2c492a173904475fa75
(cherry picked from commit 9ddb9972d3dc5442d2907727aeaa8fd3f240b049)

commit_message:
Fix `run_tests.sh` script

Because of the patch [1] there's a need to specify `FUEL_WEB_ROOT` and
`TEST_NAILGUN_DB` manually (see comments in `tox.ini`). This patch
allows to execute `tox` by means of one short command without
specifying environment variables:

    ./run_tests.sh

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/247452/

Change-Id: I55e1505747ed68495449d01916a84f0f1992df49

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 16:19:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Override osapi_volume_listen_port for test_workers

After removing WSGI from Cinder, following test cases hit
"socket.error: [Errno 98] Address already in use" error.

- test_workers_set_default
- test_workers_set_good_user_setting
- test_workers_set_zero_user_setting

The root cause is that these test cases try to use 8776 port,
but the port is used by c-api if the service exists.
This patch override default port number to avoid the error.

Change-Id: I8e2b505c2aff511969cd55851272b10c013aef6c
Closes-Bug: #1527566
'}]
commit_message:
Override osapi_volume_listen_port for test_workers

After removing WSGI from Cinder, following test cases hit
"socket.error: [Errno 98] Address already in use" error.

- test_workers_set_default
- test_workers_set_good_user_setting
- test_workers_set_zero_user_setting

The root cause is that these test cases try to use 8776 port,
but the port is used by c-api if the service exists.
This patch override default port number to avoid the error.

Change-Id: I8e2b505c2aff511969cd55851272b10c013aef6c
Closes-Bug: #1527566

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-18 01:42:31.000000000', 'files': ['AUTHORS', 'specs/mitaka/approved/mistral-rerun-update-env.rst'], 'message': 'Allow env update on task re-run

This is regarding the use case where a workflow execution failed
because of environment related issues (i.e. endpoint unavailable,
etc.). Endpoints and credentials can be passed on workflow invocation
under the env param and then accessed by workflow tasks using the
env() function. It is possible that the endpoint is replaced (i.e.
different host/ip) as part of resolving the environment related
issues or that the token passed as credential has expired. In these
cases, the user will need to be able to update the env variables
prior to re-run.

Change-Id: Icc8faf990a3cbdb8e969ae4cda56c0d06f11155f
'}]
commit_message:
Allow env update on task re-run

This is regarding the use case where a workflow execution failed
because of environment related issues (i.e. endpoint unavailable,
etc.). Endpoints and credentials can be passed on workflow invocation
under the env param and then accessed by workflow tasks using the
env() function. It is possible that the endpoint is replaced (i.e.
different host/ip) as part of resolving the environment related
issues or that the token passed as credential has expired. In these
cases, the user will need to be able to update the env variables
prior to re-run.

Change-Id: Icc8faf990a3cbdb8e969ae4cda56c0d06f11155f

In some cases, there are thousands of networks, subnets
and ports. DHCP agent sync_stat method might take a long
time and maybe lead to timeout on agent side, so that
agent can not get some infos about networks and its subnets
or ports.

This patch makes DHCP agent first check how many networks
which neutron server have and then start to fetch networks
and its info by chunks.

This approach allows to reduce the load on neutron server
side.

Closes-Bug: #1525753
Change-Id: Icef63f0363a66449cf27180c966ae664e4390052

commit_message:
DHCP agent: paginate sync networks task

In some cases, there are thousands of networks, subnets
and ports. DHCP agent sync_stat method might take a long
time and maybe lead to timeout on agent side, so that
agent can not get some infos about networks and its subnets
or ports.

This patch makes DHCP agent first check how many networks
which neutron server have and then start to fetch networks
and its info by chunks.

This approach allows to reduce the load on neutron server
side.

Closes-Bug: #1525753
Change-Id: Icef63f0363a66449cf27180c966ae664e4390052

subject: Add trustee config group to sample config
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-07 17:42:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/context.py', 'config-generator.conf', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add trustee config group to sample config

Some time ago, we added support for a new "trustee" config section,
aimed at allowing independent configuration of the credentials used
to obtain trust-scoped tokens for deferred authentication.  One of the
main reasons for this was to avoid incorrectly using the keystone
auth_token section, and as such a deprecation warning was added when
we fall back to using that config section for heat.

Unfortunately we didn't capture this new section in the sample config
because it's registered via keystoneclient.auth, so this adds support
for this section to the sample config generated via tox -e genconfig,
and adds some notes clarifying usage to the auth_plugin option.

To move to the new config syntax, but maintain the current behavior,
which is to delegate to the heat service user, you can add this section
to your heat.conf

[trustee]
auth_plugin = password
auth_url = http://<keystone hostname or IP>:35357
username = heat
password = password
user_domain_id = default

The generated config documents many more options, all of those supported
by the keystoneclient v3 Password auth plugin, but these are the minimum
to enable delegation to the heat service user in the default domain.

In new deployments this could be set to some other user (such as one created
in the heat domain), but note that the trustee should not be changed for
existing deployments where stacks exist, as the trust stored inside heat
defines a relationship between the stack owner (trustor) and a specific
trustee (which will be the heat service user if the deployment is using
the deprecated path that steals credentials from keystone auth_token).

Change-Id: I30aeb765a2246ce54b10972ae7187655d85cde1f
Partial-Bug: #1300246
'}]
commit_message:
Add trustee config group to sample config

Some time ago, we added support for a new "trustee" config section,
aimed at allowing independent configuration of the credentials used
to obtain trust-scoped tokens for deferred authentication.  One of the
main reasons for this was to avoid incorrectly using the keystone
auth_token section, and as such a deprecation warning was added when
we fall back to using that config section for heat.

Unfortunately we didn't capture this new section in the sample config
because it's registered via keystoneclient.auth, so this adds support
for this section to the sample config generated via tox -e genconfig,
and adds some notes clarifying usage to the auth_plugin option.

To move to the new config syntax, but maintain the current behavior,
which is to delegate to the heat service user, you can add this section
to your heat.conf

[trustee]
auth_plugin = password
auth_url = http://<keystone hostname or IP>:35357
username = heat
password = password
user_domain_id = default

The generated config documents many more options, all of those supported
by the keystoneclient v3 Password auth plugin, but these are the minimum
to enable delegation to the heat service user in the default domain.

In new deployments this could be set to some other user (such as one created
in the heat domain), but note that the trustee should not be changed for
existing deployments where stacks exist, as the trust stored inside heat
defines a relationship between the stack owner (trustor) and a specific
trustee (which will be the heat service user if the deployment is using
the deprecated path that steals credentials from keystone auth_token).

Change-Id: I30aeb765a2246ce54b10972ae7187655d85cde1f
Partial-Bug: #1300246

commit_message:
Gate requirements repo on docs

The requirements project runs a docs publishing post job, let's get
on it as well so that the post job runs.

Looking at current post jobs, the job fails on liberty. There's no need
to run the job on stable branches, gating and publishing
just from master is fine.

Change-Id: Icd52ed086ab7d5eb6153f9cd9257eb4a52daf728

subject: Add OVERCLOUD_IMAGES_ARGS environment variable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 17:04:47.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Add OVERCLOUD_IMAGES_ARGS environment variable

Add a new OVERCLOUD_IMAGES_ARGS environment varible to allow modify the
parameters which we call the `openstack overcloud image build`. For
backwards compatibility and general purpose, this variable is
initialized to `--all`.

This change opens the door to build a single image by overriding the env
var to values like `--type overcloud-full` or more complex calls.

Change-Id: Iaa4d20f8cfdbd92744186e54cf35a21962ef6f6e
'}]
commit_message:
Add OVERCLOUD_IMAGES_ARGS environment variable

Add a new OVERCLOUD_IMAGES_ARGS environment varible to allow modify the
parameters which we call the `openstack overcloud image build`. For
backwards compatibility and general purpose, this variable is
initialized to `--all`.

This change opens the door to build a single image by overriding the env
var to values like `--type overcloud-full` or more complex calls.

Change-Id: Iaa4d20f8cfdbd92744186e54cf35a21962ef6f6e

When nova-net is enabled and CONF.validation.run_validation = True,
the following tests fail:

    1. test_can_create_server_with_max_number_personality_files
    2. test_create_server_with_personality

This patch is to fix the issue.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 12:55:02.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/db/sqlalchemy/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/009_add_database_indices.py'], 'message': 'Fix DB migration 009 constraint dropping

Database migration 009 fails to run on Centos with errors
about indexes not existing. This occurs on a fresh installation
where no previous data, etc. The indexes being dropped in migration
009 were likely automatically added by some other MySQL
version/distribution so to support both cases we add a simple
check to ensure the index exists before attempting to drop it.

Change-Id: Ib6d848c1e32bbab6fdb7e30009f5c5f907fd8477
Closes-bug: #1526463
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DB migration 009 constraint dropping

Database migration 009 fails to run on Centos with errors
about indexes not existing. This occurs on a fresh installation
where no previous data, etc. The indexes being dropped in migration
009 were likely automatically added by some other MySQL
version/distribution so to support both cases we add a simple
check to ensure the index exists before attempting to drop it.

Change-Id: Ib6d848c1e32bbab6fdb7e30009f5c5f907fd8477
Closes-bug: #1526463

- Create Singletone to use it as metaclass in ssh_manager.

  Now it used so:
    SSHManager().method(node_ip, *parameters)
  We will not get back SSHClient, we will just say 'Do IT on NODE with this PARAM'
  e.g SSHManager().execute_on_remote('127.0.0.1', 'bash_command')

commit_message:
Introduction of new method of SSH connection

- Create Singletone to use it as metaclass in ssh_manager.
  Singleton provides us posibility of having only one instance of class.
- Create SSHManagaer, wich will manage SSH connections by itself.
  Almost SSHClient methods was duplicated in SSHManager.
  Now it used so:
    SSHManager().method(node_ip, *parameters)
  We will not get back SSHClient, we will just say 'Do IT on NODE with this PARAM'
  e.g SSHManager().execute_on_remote('127.0.0.1', 'bash_command')
- Use ssh_manager in cli_cluster_deletion test

Change-Id: I307d7d71e814b67d20cc0b4648cf6a7dac4a7829
Closes-Bug: #1503210

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-07 04:59:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Scheduler: correct control flow when forcing host

If force_hosts or force_nodes is set in the RequestSpec during
scheduling, filters should be skipped. But the according behavior is not
completely implemented in Ib529cf8eccc4d8abe67873cfc0467f6db9d4b522
because the empty `name_to_cls_map` will still be passed to filters.

The previous implementation didn't introduce any bugs because empty
hosts can be passed to `get_filtered_object()`. The return value is
also empty, which is identical to the expected, but this leads
to unecessary process effort and wrong log messages. It is also
misleading to developers.

Change-Id: Ic473a9a96ce231ce4300a0294e797aae9a19970c
"}]
commit_message:
Scheduler: correct control flow when forcing host

If force_hosts or force_nodes is set in the RequestSpec during
scheduling, filters should be skipped. But the according behavior is not
completely implemented in Ib529cf8eccc4d8abe67873cfc0467f6db9d4b522
because the empty `name_to_cls_map` will still be passed to filters.

The previous implementation didn't introduce any bugs because empty
hosts can be passed to `get_filtered_object()`. The return value is
also empty, which is identical to the expected, but this leads
to unecessary process effort and wrong log messages. It is also
misleading to developers.

Change-Id: Ic473a9a96ce231ce4300a0294e797aae9a19970c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 14:58:24.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix constraint jobs branch

neutron-docs-constraints and neutron-coverage-constraints have been
running on all branches - and also we have neutron-docs and
neutron-coverage running only on stable/kilo.

So, currently both kind of jobs are run on stable/kilo.
From the layout output:
  <Job neutron-docs> ^(?:stable/kilo).*$
  <Job neutron-docs-constraints>
  <Job neutron-coverage> ^(?:stable/kilo).*$
  <Job neutron-coverage-constraints>

Change the existing constraints job to not only cover gate jobs but also
these post jobs.

Change-Id: Ic1f370968aa93c6abbcf7667fe757037987f96d1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix constraint jobs branch

neutron-docs-constraints and neutron-coverage-constraints have been
running on all branches - and also we have neutron-docs and
neutron-coverage running only on stable/kilo.

So, currently both kind of jobs are run on stable/kilo.
From the layout output:
  <Job neutron-docs> ^(?:stable/kilo).*$
  <Job neutron-docs-constraints>
  <Job neutron-coverage> ^(?:stable/kilo).*$
  <Job neutron-coverage-constraints>

Change the existing constraints job to not only cover gate jobs but also
these post jobs.

Change-Id: Ic1f370968aa93c6abbcf7667fe757037987f96d1

commit_message:
Show a better error message for network delete failure

Previously deleting a network shows an unclear
error message:

Error: Failed to delete network <network_name>

With this fix it will now show proper error message:

Error: Failed to delete network <network_name>. One or
more ports have an IP allocation from the associated
subnet <subnet_id>.

Change-Id: I32e3c54f7ee5b5a23df73797e79545afd34ed69d
Closes-Bug: #1400667

commit_message:
Clean up baymodel query of usage from a bay

For baymodel reference of a bay, we can use bay.baymodel instead of using
bay.baymodel_id to get baymodel object, this patch does a cleanup.

Implemented: blueprint add-baymodel-object-to-bay
Change-Id: I568cc090d37d6666d8d02e87788aa5fff79e46e8

commit_message:
Fixes Python 3 compatibility for filter results

Python 2.7 filter method result was a list, while for
Python 3.4 the result is a "filter object". Trying to
use it as a list will result in a TypeError.

Enables some unit tests for gate-nova-python34.

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I681b084bc96fc293488ddbc03218b9c449555578

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-21 09:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_replicationcontroller.py', 'magnum/objects/bay.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_service.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/objects/test_bay.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/objects/utils.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_pod.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Object: Add BayModel as an ObjectField to Bay object

It is inconvenient to get baymodel from a bay, such as:
        bay = objects.Bay.get_by_uuid(pecan.request.context, obj.bay_uuid)
        baymodel = objects.BayModel.get_by_uuid(pecan.request.context,
                                                bay.baymodel_id)

We can load baymodel as an ObjectField of bay, then we can refer bay.baymodel
to get that bay's baymodel.

This patch requires version bump of Bay object.
Implemented: blueprint add-baymodel-object-to-bay
Change-Id: I04e52a16225416cd8da9342ce9cce2959373c887
"}]
commit_message:
Object: Add BayModel as an ObjectField to Bay object

It is inconvenient to get baymodel from a bay, such as:
        bay = objects.Bay.get_by_uuid(pecan.request.context, obj.bay_uuid)
        baymodel = objects.BayModel.get_by_uuid(pecan.request.context,
                                                bay.baymodel_id)

We can load baymodel as an ObjectField of bay, then we can refer bay.baymodel
to get that bay's baymodel.

This patch requires version bump of Bay object.
Implemented: blueprint add-baymodel-object-to-bay
Change-Id: I04e52a16225416cd8da9342ce9cce2959373c887

libvirt: wrapper list_guests to Host's object

new method instance of list_instance_domains

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 11:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/conf.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/ceph/ceph-osd.pp'], 'message': "Fix resource ordering for Ceph_conf

Ceph_conf provider can be used only if ceph.conf file exists.
ceph.conf is created by different commands depending on host
role, so we can use File['/root/ceph.conf'] as point after
which ceph_conf provider can be used.

Closes-bug: #1527185

Change-Id: I0ee4accf066a1482804c4b39c35010b71c74ef80
"}]
commit_message:
Fix resource ordering for Ceph_conf

Ceph_conf provider can be used only if ceph.conf file exists.
ceph.conf is created by different commands depending on host
role, so we can use File['/root/ceph.conf'] as point after
which ceph_conf provider can be used.

Closes-bug: #1527185

Change-Id: I0ee4accf066a1482804c4b39c35010b71c74ef80

commit_message:
Prototype: get-valid-server-state

This is easy explanation for bp/get-valid-server-state
Of couse, do not merge.

Current patch contains the following problem:

 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py", line 719, in post_process_extensions
     **action_args)
 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/openstack/compute/extended_server_attributes.py", line 61, in show
     self._extend_server(context, server, db_instance, req)
 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/openstack/compute/extended_server_attributes.py", line 50, in _extend_server
     host_status = self.compute_api.get_instance_host_status(instance)
AttributeError: 'API' object has no attribute 'get_instance_host_status'

Change-Id: Ibe1039ad85a3a6eba9a1daa4af8c9c301a6af468

commit_message:
Correct set_node_options argument list

With no longer setting a node default, Zuul won't pass it as a
parameter to the set_node_options() parameter function. Drop it from
the required arguments for this function.

Change-Id: I2aa8f7179ecb0bdf6bd8785653f1726321bbcb7f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 23:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Turn bluebox servers off in nodepool.

Bluebox is performing maintenance soon. It would be friendliest
if nodepool wasn't asking for vms on their cloud whilst they
do their maintenance. This patch sets bluebox max_servers to 0.

Change-Id: I6e147b3e142dc185b2752f25007fca8c26d03e2d
"}]
commit_message:
Turn bluebox servers off in nodepool.

Bluebox is performing maintenance soon. It would be friendliest
if nodepool wasn't asking for vms on their cloud whilst they
do their maintenance. This patch sets bluebox max_servers to 0.

Change-Id: I6e147b3e142dc185b2752f25007fca8c26d03e2d

Now that there are no jobs declaring both .*-precise and .*-trusty
nodes at the same time, it is safe to remove the associated mapping
in Zuul and let it trust that any worker registering the job name
is capable of running it sanely.

This should not be approved until manual jenkins-jobs updates have
been completed and confirmed successful on all Jenkins masters.

Change-Id: I3b40021ffbf89842ed3a53412dfffa119f311797
'}]
commit_message:
Remove precise/trusty label mapping in Zuul config

Now that there are no jobs declaring both .*-precise and .*-trusty
nodes at the same time, it is safe to remove the associated mapping
in Zuul and let it trust that any worker registering the job name
is capable of running it sanely.

This should not be approved until manual jenkins-jobs updates have
been completed and confirmed successful on all Jenkins masters.

Change-Id: I3b40021ffbf89842ed3a53412dfffa119f311797

subject: Fix duplication for headers in Access-Control-Expose-Headers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12193, 'name': 'Hisashi Osanai', 'email': 'osanai.hisashi@jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'ho'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-21 07:27:42.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix duplication for headers in Access-Control-Expose-Headers

There are following problems with Access-Control-Expose-Headers.

* If headers in X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Expose-Headers are
  configured, the headers are kept with case-sensitive string.
  Then a CORS request comes, the headers are merged into
  Access-Control-Expose-Headers as case-sensitive string even if
  there is a same header which is not case-sensitive string.

* Access-Control-Expose-Headers is handled by a list.
  If X-Container/Object-Meta-XXX is configured in container/object
  and X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Expose-Headers, same header
  is listed in Access-Control-Expose-Headers.

This patch provides a fix for the problems.

Change-Id: Ifc1c14eb3833ec6a851631cfc23008648463bd81
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplication for headers in Access-Control-Expose-Headers

There are following problems with Access-Control-Expose-Headers.

* If headers in X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Expose-Headers are
  configured, the headers are kept with case-sensitive string.
  Then a CORS request comes, the headers are merged into
  Access-Control-Expose-Headers as case-sensitive string even if
  there is a same header which is not case-sensitive string.

* Access-Control-Expose-Headers is handled by a list.
  If X-Container/Object-Meta-XXX is configured in container/object
  and X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Expose-Headers, same header
  is listed in Access-Control-Expose-Headers.

This patch provides a fix for the problems.

Change-Id: Ifc1c14eb3833ec6a851631cfc23008648463bd81

commit_message:
Make 3 functions in network_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes create_bulk_port, create_bulk_subnet,
create_bulk_network of network_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I992769608dedeb4afa752130240ad60e709a99fe

subject: Add nice and peaceful message around `get_lock` of some drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 22:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/mysql.py', 'requirements.txt', 'tooz/drivers/file.py', 'tooz/drivers/ipc.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/drivers/pgsql.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': "Add nice and peaceful message around `get_lock` of some drivers

Some of these drivers `get_lock` work best under circumstances and
situations which the openstack community does not care to support
so in order to denote this start to add depreciation to the
methods that provide these locks (the rest of the coordinator,
which still provides group membership concepts, hopefully is still
useful, for now).

People supposedly don't read the docs or warnings anyway (since people
can't read and understand capabilities of drivers they use) so this
is a best effort attempt at trying to tell people about using these.

Change-Id: Ic56ec2911ab877e32a20ecea6c6568727799521f
"}]
commit_message:
Add nice and peaceful message around `get_lock` of some drivers

Some of these drivers `get_lock` work best under circumstances and
situations which the openstack community does not care to support
so in order to denote this start to add depreciation to the
methods that provide these locks (the rest of the coordinator,
which still provides group membership concepts, hopefully is still
useful, for now).

People supposedly don't read the docs or warnings anyway (since people
can't read and understand capabilities of drivers they use) so this
is a best effort attempt at trying to tell people about using these.

Change-Id: Ic56ec2911ab877e32a20ecea6c6568727799521f

commit_message:
TestServerGeneral: Add test for _prep_server_detail()

1. Make TestServerGeneral inherit from TestServer because
   we need to use servers_mock, image_mock and flavor_mock
   in compute_client.
2. Create a dict containing all info of a server in the
   original format, and pass it to _prep_server_detail().
3. Compare the original and formatted dict.

Change-Id: Ie0b83c42a5c3bbba630a064d28374d07e2ce9caf
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement

commit_message:
Make volume_types_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes volume_types_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I51d02186fae7165c905b031f16c6682b5edf0a55

subject: Provide a specific dashboard configuration for the flat network
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-21 05:27:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/horizon-install.rst'], 'message': 'Provide a specific dashboard configuration for the flat network

After add networking service using provider networks,
access the dashboard will throw many errors.
e.g.
"Unable to retrieve floating IP addresses"
"Unable to retrieve floating IP addresses"
"Unable to retrieve router list."
And this bug will make dashboard can't load network topology.
Using dashboard to create instance will be unsuccessful too.
In my opinion, provider network is a two layer network,
so It does not relate to the three layer network.
It is normal that dashboard throws these errors.
What we need to do is just to modify some parameters
when we configure the dashboard.

Change-Id: I69dee623fe20dec011ce6eed694e482dd9e688d9
Close-bug: #1526721
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a specific dashboard configuration for the flat network

After add networking service using provider networks,
access the dashboard will throw many errors.
e.g.
"Unable to retrieve floating IP addresses"
"Unable to retrieve floating IP addresses"
"Unable to retrieve router list."
And this bug will make dashboard can't load network topology.
Using dashboard to create instance will be unsuccessful too.
In my opinion, provider network is a two layer network,
so It does not relate to the three layer network.
It is normal that dashboard throws these errors.
What we need to do is just to modify some parameters
when we configure the dashboard.

Change-Id: I69dee623fe20dec011ce6eed694e482dd9e688d9
Close-bug: #1526721

subject: Gate: Attempt to fix a memory allocation error
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-12-21 14:57:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-functional-test.rst', 'magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'magnum/tests/functional/python_client_base.py'], 'message': 'Gate: Attempt to fix a memory allocation error

This random error is due to the different swap space at different
test hosts. In particular, there is a provider who provides VMs with
0 swap space, while other providers provide VMs with 8G swap space.
As a result, Magnum jobs failed at VMs with 0 swap space.

This commit reduces memory consumption of Magnum jobs by reducing the
bay node flavor from 2G to 1G. I consider this as a temporary fix.
A permanent fix should be from infra side to make the swap space
consistent across test nodes.

Partial-Bug: #1521237
Change-Id: Ia043fab1f7665f7299e4094634e02c42b43dcce1
'}]
commit_message:
Gate: Attempt to fix a memory allocation error

This random error is due to the different swap space at different
test hosts. In particular, there is a provider who provides VMs with
0 swap space, while other providers provide VMs with 8G swap space.
As a result, Magnum jobs failed at VMs with 0 swap space.

This commit reduces memory consumption of Magnum jobs by reducing the
bay node flavor from 2G to 1G. I consider this as a temporary fix.
A permanent fix should be from infra side to make the swap space
consistent across test nodes.

Partial-Bug: #1521237
Change-Id: Ia043fab1f7665f7299e4094634e02c42b43dcce1

subject: Add 'EVENT' checking for scaling policy.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-22 01:05:54.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/policies/test_policy.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/actions/test_action_base.py', 'senlin/policies/scaling_policy.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/policies/test_scaling_policy.py', 'senlin/policies/base.py', 'senlin/engine/actions/base.py'], 'message': "Add 'EVENT' checking for scaling policy.

In 'policy_check' method will do following checking for each
binding policy,

   1) check whether in policy.TARGET
   2) check whether in policy's coolddown
   3) pre_op or post_op checking

In the first stage checking, it is not enough to only check
policy's TARGET for scaling policy, we also need check policy's
EVENT. Otherwise, for a CLUSTER_SCALE_IN action, it will still
do stage 2 and 3 checking for a scaling_out policy.

Change-Id: I055a2cf477d755cfedc1fb900dfffc3646e49ded
Closes-Bug: #1526597
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'EVENT' checking for scaling policy.

In 'policy_check' method will do following checking for each
binding policy,

   1) check whether in policy.TARGET
   2) check whether in policy's coolddown
   3) pre_op or post_op checking

In the first stage checking, it is not enough to only check
policy's TARGET for scaling policy, we also need check policy's
EVENT. Otherwise, for a CLUSTER_SCALE_IN action, it will still
do stage 2 and 3 checking for a scaling_out policy.

Change-Id: I055a2cf477d755cfedc1fb900dfffc3646e49ded
Closes-Bug: #1526597

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-17 08:03:41.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/status_model.py', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/datalog/base.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/tests/api/test_status_model.py'], 'message': 'Prepare Status Model API for the new architecture

Status Model API relies on python references to access policy engine
and datasource class. In the new architecture, API model needs to
use RPC calling.

This patch changes Status Model API to use rpc style method calling.
And Status API for a policy enables client to use either policy name
or id in its URL.

Implements blueprint dist-api-rpcify-status
Change-Id: Ic8c9a18567fdaf18ebc0d78ee6d0adb01b5e9980
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare Status Model API for the new architecture

Status Model API relies on python references to access policy engine
and datasource class. In the new architecture, API model needs to
use RPC calling.

This patch changes Status Model API to use rpc style method calling.
And Status API for a policy enables client to use either policy name
or id in its URL.

Implements blueprint dist-api-rpcify-status
Change-Id: Ic8c9a18567fdaf18ebc0d78ee6d0adb01b5e9980

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-21 16:32:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_dbv2.py'], 'message': 'Fix db refresh race condition bug

There were a few test failures that exposed a race condition when an entity was
retrieved from the db twice.  The second retrieval was on a session refresh.
If a delete of that entity occurred right before the refresh, the refresh would
fail because that entity did not exist anymore.

The solution is to simply not do two reads.  Combined with the patch
in neutron that this depends on, this will fix the reason the refresh
existed and the race condition.

Closes-Bug: #1504465
Change-Id: If160d65df3448e2790fc869d7293cc750f6775b7'}]
commit_message:
Fix db refresh race condition bug

There were a few test failures that exposed a race condition when an entity was
retrieved from the db twice.  The second retrieval was on a session refresh.
If a delete of that entity occurred right before the refresh, the refresh would
fail because that entity did not exist anymore.

The solution is to simply not do two reads.  Combined with the patch
in neutron that this depends on, this will fix the reason the refresh
existed and the race condition.

Closes-Bug: #1504465
Change-Id: If160d65df3448e2790fc869d7293cc750f6775b7

commit_message:
Add upload/download vhd2 interfaces

This adds interfaces to the glance plugin for uploading / downloading
vhd files by glance url instead of with a host / port / use_ssl
tuple. This makes it possible to have glance hosted on a non root url
and still work with xenserver.

This bumps the plugin version to 1.3 as these are new functions exposed.

Convert xenapi driver to using up/down vhd2

All unit test converted to use this new functionality.

Change-Id: I73f60de0b1644827238961e1659b0119b80bf82f

Between the Icehouse and Juno releases, OpenStack changed its
supported Ubuntu LTS platform from Precise to Trusty. In support of
continuing testing stable/icehouse and prior branches on Precise
while starting to test newer branches on Trusty, a branch-based
decision tree was introduced into our Zuul configuration by way of
complex parameter functions with an ever growing list of regular
expression matches on job names.

Now that Icehouse is EOL (in fact, Juno is too) this simply adds
unnecessary complexity and an attractive nuisance for cargo-cult

and so manual jenkins-jobs updates on all Jenkins masters will be

Change-Id: Ic952ee02da2c77fe2ace81c4e2fa87531be6119c
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of precise||trusty job node declarations

Between the Icehouse and Juno releases, OpenStack changed its
supported Ubuntu LTS platform from Precise to Trusty. In support of
continuing testing stable/icehouse and prior branches on Precise
while starting to test newer branches on Trusty, a branch-based
decision tree was introduced into our Zuul configuration by way of
complex parameter functions with an ever growing list of regular
expression matches on job names.

Now that Icehouse is EOL (in fact, Juno is too) this simply adds
unnecessary complexity and an attractive nuisance for cargo-cult
copying into new job and job-template definitions which don't even
need it. In preparation to remove the associated parameter
functions, get rid of multiple labels in all jobs and set them to
whatever label Zuul would ultimately select.

This change touches a vast number, possibly a majority, of our jobs
and so manual jenkins-jobs updates on all Jenkins masters will be
needed after this merges, before it's safe to approve the
corresponding Zuul configuration cleanup.

Change-Id: Ic952ee02da2c77fe2ace81c4e2fa87531be6119c

commit_message:
Neutron VPNaaS: Set default service provider

Default value needs to be set for service_provider config item in
neutron_vpnaas.conf. This is to support backward compatability
for using the enable_service q-vpn. It should be noted that the
recommended way to use VPN is the devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I0d5960c81c47a138087d480527eff2a8eef59445
Closes-bug: #1527483

commit_message:
Bump minimum tempest-lib version

Now we(Tempest team) are migrating common part of Tempest to tempest-lib
for running Tempest-like test on each project repository.
That work requires the latest tempest-lib. So this patch bumps minimum
tempest-lib version.

Change-Id: Ifa69e6c0ecc12d47bb4c53b9b436c2463f1932e2

subject: Fix unmount/remove race in cleanup_build_dir
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-18 20:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['lib/common-functions'], 'message': 'Fix unmount/remove race in cleanup_build_dir

With a slow file system, umount can return 0 and the immediately
following remove can fail with a "Device or resource busy" error.
This happened in DevStack in disk-image-create where unmount_image
is followed by an immediate cleanup_build_dir.

Solution is to apply same logic from bug 1332521 to allow the
remove to retry on failure (up to 5s) in case the umount has not
completed.

Change-Id: I3337e2b4ad0111e77f79dc179439cdfea8ebdeda
Closes-Bug: #1527721
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unmount/remove race in cleanup_build_dir

With a slow file system, umount can return 0 and the immediately
following remove can fail with a "Device or resource busy" error.
This happened in DevStack in disk-image-create where unmount_image
is followed by an immediate cleanup_build_dir.

Solution is to apply same logic from bug 1332521 to allow the
remove to retry on failure (up to 5s) in case the umount has not
completed.

Change-Id: I3337e2b4ad0111e77f79dc179439cdfea8ebdeda
Closes-Bug: #1527721

Bifrost's inventory parsing code supports parsing json and yaml
data input.

As such, we need to test that we are producing the expected
output from passing data into the general data parser,
including re-parsing the output of a previous conversion
to ensure that it is unchanged so logic parity remains

Change-Id: I95b3941f898b14bffa3a4a6fc6972184889cfedc
"}]
commit_message:
Add JSON/YAML inventory consumption tests

Bifrost's inventory parsing code supports parsing json and yaml
data input.

As such, we need to test that we are producing the expected
output from passing data into the general data parser,
including re-parsing the output of a previous conversion
to ensure that it is unchanged so logic parity remains
across conversion methods for any new items added.
Closes-Bug: #1527380
Change-Id: I95b3941f898b14bffa3a4a6fc6972184889cfedc

distros such as Fedora, CentOS and RHEL.

An IpNetwork can associate 1-1 with a Network and can

"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Basic extension and CRUD for IP network

This patch enables basic CRUD on Routed networks by
defining a new entitiy called 'IpNetwork'.

An IpNetwork can associate 1-1 with a Network and can
be a parent to another IpNetwork.  But, only if it is
not bound to a Network. This is somewhat intuitive if
you think of an IpNetwork used on an L2 broadcast domain.
The IpNetwork stretches at least throughout the L2 and
can stretch beyond by routing.

In addition, a new RBAC object-type called 'ip-network'
is also defined for sharing 'IpNetwork' across tenants
via RBAC policy.

Outstanding Items:
 - Add applicable Unit/API tests.

Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
Co-Authored-By: Carl Baldwin <carl@ecbaldwin.net>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <rktidwell85@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I77ac9e492ec18cc8b25156f5f4ff8a955bfe9b7d

The Unicode type is 'unicode' in Python 2 and 'str' on Python 3.
This patch replaces unicode with six.text_type to make Nova
compatible with Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Ib9e64b2b63d1e4f343dc2d27f409436305143675
"}]
commit_message:
Replace unicode with six.text_type

The Unicode type is 'unicode' in Python 2 and 'str' on Python 3.
This patch replaces unicode with six.text_type to make Nova
compatible with Python 2 and Python 3.

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: Ib9e64b2b63d1e4f343dc2d27f409436305143675

subject: Fix mean runtime value on jobs page
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-21 15:47:38.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/controllers/job.js'], 'message': "Fix mean runtime value on jobs page

This commit fixes the calculation of the mean runtime on the jobs page.
Previously it was just summing the runtime returned from the rest api,
which isn't really a mean. While taking a moving average of a bunch of
moving averages doesn't lead to the best value it is still better than
a sum.

Change-Id: I010b99c4a038ebd9154190ef606449b5cd3e2988
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mean runtime value on jobs page

This commit fixes the calculation of the mean runtime on the jobs page.
Previously it was just summing the runtime returned from the rest api,
which isn't really a mean. While taking a moving average of a bunch of
moving averages doesn't lead to the best value it is still better than
a sum.

Change-Id: I010b99c4a038ebd9154190ef606449b5cd3e2988

commit_message:
support for snapshot management

Add support to manage/unmanage snapshot

cinder snapshot-manage volume identifier
option args is --id-type, --name, --description,
--metadata.

cinder snapshot-unmanage snapshot

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint support-for-snapshot-management
Change-Id: Id4d73fa0ff0c0c05c0c69924968aa2154da64118

Renamed code samples using this naming convention:\n  <resource>-<action>-request.json or <resource>-<action>-response.json.\n  For example, volume-create-request.json and volume-create-response.json.\n- Removed unused code samples\n- Made method names consistent throughout\n- use list<resource> for list operations,\n  show<resource> for show operations, and so on.\n- Change csapi:uuid -> csapi:UUID\n\nChange-Id: I88a07329b6d2610c8e3b8dd4a639040832b7582c\nPartial-Bug: #1521244\n'}]
commit_message:
Update Compute API to spellcheck

- Remove passive voice from api-site
- Renamed code samples using this naming convention:
  <resource>-<action>-request.json or <resource>-<action>-response.json.
  For example, volume-create-request.json and volume-create-response.json.
- Removed unused code samples
- Made method names consistent throughout
- use list<resource> for list operations,
  show<resource> for show operations, and so on.
- Change csapi:uuid -> csapi:UUID

Change-Id: I88a07329b6d2610c8e3b8dd4a639040832b7582c
Partial-Bug: #1521244

subject: Barbican does not support python34 in kilo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-21 21:53:24.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Barbican does not support python34 in kilo

Remove the python34 checks from stable/kilo as it's not supported.

Change-Id: Iabe87db225dff2fc59eff5a230af7bf0a4a344de
"}]
commit_message:
Barbican does not support python34 in kilo

Remove the python34 checks from stable/kilo as it's not supported.

Change-Id: Iabe87db225dff2fc59eff5a230af7bf0a4a344de

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-27 09:53:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ha-guide/source/controller-ha-haproxy.rst'], 'message': '[ha-guide] Update nova_vncproxy_cluster in haproxy configuration

Replace spice_cluster with nova_vncproxy_cluster with.

if you want to use spicehtml5proxy,add following configuration in haproxy.conf:

listen nova_spicehtml5proxy_cluster
bind <Virtual IP>:6082
balance  source
option  tcpka
option  tcplog
server controller1 10.0.0.1:6082 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5
server controller2 10.0.0.2:6082 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5
server controller3 10.0.0.3:6082 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5

Change-Id: Ib52858bb75e17fc46e6110674eef4df5c0eb38b2
Closes-Bug: #1500154
'}]
commit_message:
[ha-guide] Update nova_vncproxy_cluster in haproxy configuration

Replace spice_cluster with nova_vncproxy_cluster with.

if you want to use spicehtml5proxy,add following configuration in haproxy.conf:

listen nova_spicehtml5proxy_cluster
bind <Virtual IP>:6082
balance  source
option  tcpka
option  tcplog
server controller1 10.0.0.1:6082 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5
server controller2 10.0.0.2:6082 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5
server controller3 10.0.0.3:6082 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5

Change-Id: Ib52858bb75e17fc46e6110674eef4df5c0eb38b2
Closes-Bug: #1500154

commit_message:
Changing severity on Bandit Baseline tox target

This commit adds a medium severity and confidence filter on the
Bandit baseline tox target.  Some of the lower threshold tests
aren't appropriate for a gate.

Change-Id: Iba75392d777bf93bece6d87b2fee4ff6b334b463

commit_message:
Fix "pkg-map failed" issue building IPA ramdisk

When installing packages of IPA element to build IPA ramdisk,
it will address "pkg-map failed" issue as map elements miss
comma in pkg-map file of IPA elemement

Closes-Bug: #1489339

Change-Id: I4fae163060f3a5ba454f62c9231a02acf14583ab

subject: Make backwards compatible qcow2s by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-24 01:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create'], 'message': "Make backwards compatible qcow2s by default

qcow2's generated with qemu-img 2.0 are not always using a qcow2 version
that is backwards compatible with many cloud providers (such as
hpcloud). Lets make compatible images by default.

Change-Id: I2e7b243b53b7be4ad2d25902a4fa0fff9bb9d24a
"}]
commit_message:
Make backwards compatible qcow2s by default

qcow2's generated with qemu-img 2.0 are not always using a qcow2 version
that is backwards compatible with many cloud providers (such as
hpcloud). Lets make compatible images by default.

Change-Id: I2e7b243b53b7be4ad2d25902a4fa0fff9bb9d24a

(cherry picked from commit ae5143cb8a1a6a57aaf12d7fcc15994f1dc0d46c)

commit_message:
Allow ssl ports in firewall

Without this, undercloud installs using ssl will not have the
appropriate ports opened.

Change-Id: Ia5bc1ec9c3faed1b63097011ec24f222d4394b34
(cherry picked from commit ae5143cb8a1a6a57aaf12d7fcc15994f1dc0d46c)

subject: Create default flavors as part of undercloud install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 18:28:13.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': "Create default flavors as part of undercloud install

We mostly do node scheduling based on profile, which means that the
actual values in the flavors don't matter in many cases. To make
the entire deploy process easier, just create the default flavors
with some sane minimum specs.  They can always be changed later
for users who want to do something different.

As part of this change, the post deploy code in undercloud.py was
refactored to be a bit more modular and easier to test.

Depends-On: I330884ec207c8bcee31961a292499165931d660a
Change-Id: I5dec6dc59fb537718d5175e70fab1d9f273d686b
(cherry picked from commit 8f714d8b4c2c7f071664b8922d7ec016e6dcced3)
"}]
commit_message:
Create default flavors as part of undercloud install

We mostly do node scheduling based on profile, which means that the
actual values in the flavors don't matter in many cases. To make
the entire deploy process easier, just create the default flavors
with some sane minimum specs.  They can always be changed later
for users who want to do something different.

As part of this change, the post deploy code in undercloud.py was
refactored to be a bit more modular and easier to test.

Depends-On: I330884ec207c8bcee31961a292499165931d660a
Change-Id: I5dec6dc59fb537718d5175e70fab1d9f273d686b
(cherry picked from commit 8f714d8b4c2c7f071664b8922d7ec016e6dcced3)

commit_message:
Group config params more logically

We have a number of parameters that are related - network_gateway
is often set to local_ip, masquerade_network is almost always
network_cidr, so it makes sense to group those params close to
each other so users see them one after the other.

Change-Id: Icd83d2587ed9bb2152296ba6edd5cf3c7daa768a
(cherry picked from commit 865c7feec9a7415bcb1a257fb522a95478376e71)

subject: Fix glance endpoints with endpoint_override
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-21 18:01:26.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Fix glance endpoints with endpoint_override

Now that we properly pass endpoint_override all the time, we broke
glance. The reason for this is that we calculate the glance url via
glance url stripping in all cases, so the case where we did not have
a configured endpoint override was passing the wrong information to the
constructor, causing double version addition.

Change-Id: I5699b0581d0cb68fed68800c29c8a847e2606ec9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix glance endpoints with endpoint_override

Now that we properly pass endpoint_override all the time, we broke
glance. The reason for this is that we calculate the glance url via
glance url stripping in all cases, so the case where we did not have
a configured endpoint override was passing the wrong information to the
constructor, causing double version addition.

Change-Id: I5699b0581d0cb68fed68800c29c8a847e2606ec9

Fix retrieving api_interface

In heterogeneous environment, api_interfaces are different each other.
So we should specify it from hostvars.

Implements: bp configure-network-interface

commit_message:
Deprecate bash ramdisks

Ironic has deprecated these for a while, so we should be notifying
our users of that fact.  This change also makes us stop using those
old ramdisks by default so we don't have to build an extra image
during CI runs.

Change-Id: I68d726bf73ba0aa10803a5fd8f523323d1fdd70e
Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2d7017ab7172f24c1696e4627ece3a63f3ddc9c8)

commit_message:
Add notes on loading strategies for ORM relationships

There have been a number of regressions caused by our inability
to thoroughly review relatiohships' loading strategies. We should
at least make an attempt to remind ourselves, and since I am guilty
as charged, this patch is my attempt to redemption.

Change-Id: I879cfceaa51386e9d6c683e7e02487df92b7e290

commit_message:
Normalize fernet payload disassembly

Rather than have all the disassembly functions return different
tuples, have them all return the same arguments so that the caller
can treat them all the same rather than having a big switch
statement.

Change-Id: Idcef1b3ea8d51775e88711d7ef7cf61173eda42c

commit_message:
Do not fail with Tox 2.3.1

Latest tox causes failures:
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tox/config.py", line 1140, in processcommand
     argv = list(shlexer)
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shlex.py", line 269, in next
     token = self.get_token()
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shlex.py", line 96, in get_token
     raw = self.read_token()
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shlex.py", line 172, in read_token
     raise ValueError, "No closing quotation"
 ValueError: No closing quotation

This is caused by a backwards incompatible change in tox:
https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/181

Change-Id: Ic28c634cf806394cfa82b61cb45be60b8f40a61a

commit_message:
Refactor 'detach vopt' to use detach_storage

pypowervm.tasks.scsi_mapper.detach_storage provides the function to
detach the storage element from VSCSI mappings.  This logic was
previously inlined in nova_powervm.virt.powervm.media.add_dlt_vopt_tasks
- this change set replaces the inline code with the pypowervm call.

Change-Id: Ica5096e4150d76c79c198073a3b96dab5789ab57

commit_message:
Set tunnel timeout for nova_novncproxy

When using websockets in HAProxy, like nova_novncproxy does, we
need to set "timeout tunnel" to avoid disconnections after a short
period without traffic.

Change-Id: I1b66cd9a1d20cbbe35a2ada5782a76a01b14bcd1
Closes-BZ: 1267043
(cherry picked from commit 4945e2f4d321b31a0dec3ce0a53cf88fcbc41591)

subject: Fix telemetry tests to use v1 create image correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-16 06:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/telemetry/test_telemetry_notification_api.py', 'tempest/api/telemetry/base.py'], 'message': "Fix telemetry tests to use v1 create image correctly

Telemetry create image using v1 as well as v2 glance service client.
And Glance has different set of expected param between v1 and v2.

But Telemetry tests pass common arg in both case and end up with wrong
arg for v1 image-create('visibility' is unexpected)

Caught this issue on Ia03d5e8fdf7d7eac338665670b561e452a1d31d9

This commit fix this issue.

Change-Id: I14e16a1a7d9813b324ee40545c07f0e88fb637b7
Closes-Bug: #1526617
"}]
commit_message:
Fix telemetry tests to use v1 create image correctly

Telemetry create image using v1 as well as v2 glance service client.
And Glance has different set of expected param between v1 and v2.

But Telemetry tests pass common arg in both case and end up with wrong
arg for v1 image-create('visibility' is unexpected)

Caught this issue on Ia03d5e8fdf7d7eac338665670b561e452a1d31d9

This commit fix this issue.

Change-Id: I14e16a1a7d9813b324ee40545c07f0e88fb637b7
Closes-Bug: #1526617

subject: Add interface to enable setting up repositories on nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 21:27:09.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/config/yum_repos.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml'], 'message': 'Add interface to enable setting up repositories on nodes

Adds an interface which configures yum repos on the nodes,
should it not be required, the resource_registry entry can simply
be replaced with a mapping to OS::Heat::None, or the default implementation
which sets up the same repos we use in CI can easily be replaced by some
other implementation such as subscription-manager etc.

To simply override the default map of repos, you can pass an
environment file in this format with any repo URLs desired, which
should be useful when testing updates/upgrades between versions
as we can easily pass different delorean urls etc.

parameter_defaults:
  YumRepositoryList:
   - url: "http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/delorean-deps.repo"
     path: "/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo"
     priority: 30
   - url: "http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current/delorean.repo"
     path: "/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo"
     priority: 20
   - url: "http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-tripleo/delorean.repo"
     path: "/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo"
     priority: 10

Change-Id: I9e6b5397d5db30f84ce73b5b7c1ac050c3ae5da9
'}]
commit_message:
Add interface to enable setting up repositories on nodes

Adds an interface which configures yum repos on the nodes,
should it not be required, the resource_registry entry can simply
be replaced with a mapping to OS::Heat::None, or the default implementation
which sets up the same repos we use in CI can easily be replaced by some
other implementation such as subscription-manager etc.

To simply override the default map of repos, you can pass an
environment file in this format with any repo URLs desired, which
should be useful when testing updates/upgrades between versions
as we can easily pass different delorean urls etc.

parameter_defaults:
  YumRepositoryList:
   - url: "http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/delorean-deps.repo"
     path: "/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo"
     priority: 30
   - url: "http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current/delorean.repo"
     path: "/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo"
     priority: 20
   - url: "http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-tripleo/delorean.repo"
     path: "/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo"
     priority: 10

Change-Id: I9e6b5397d5db30f84ce73b5b7c1ac050c3ae5da9

commit_message:
Revert 'Remove image to local block device mapping'

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153203/3 added check
for novaclient, removed the logic for both
--image and --block-device are added.

But actually the following valid boot command failed
due to the change here, so this patch reverted original
one and add some descriptions to avoid further removal.

nova boot test-vm --flavor m1.medium --image centos-vm-32
--nic net-id=c3f40e33-d535-4217-916b-1450b8cd3987
--block-device id=26b7b917-2794-452a-95e5-2efb2ca6e32d,bus=sata,
source=volume,bootindex=1

Change-Id: Ia29e63c72b34d3038aa591c466425e65edf5755b
Partial-Bug: #1433609
(cherry picked from commit 8679eedb8352630012202c12a9c9acf8757802a5)

subject: Install local docker registry with puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-18 21:49:28.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/10-iptables'], 'message': "Install local docker registry with puppet

This is for overcloud usage for when containerized services are
deployed. Using a local registry allows for faster network transfers
after the initial pull to other nodes. The puppet config option to enable
this functionality is 'enable_docker_registry'.

The RPM dependencies for docker-registry not already included in instack
is as follows:
    python-blinker
    c-ares
    python-gunicorn
    libev
    python-gevent
    python-backports-lzma
    m2crypto

The registry default port of 5000 conflicts with keystone, so it has
been changed to 8787 instead. Iptables rule for port 8787 has been added
to allow outside access.

Change-Id: I40e871f9017315886b1aac256f3fd6b9778ac21b
(cherry picked from commit 623be791cea48583d50779cef1649508e912817f)
"}]
commit_message:
Install local docker registry with puppet

This is for overcloud usage for when containerized services are
deployed. Using a local registry allows for faster network transfers
after the initial pull to other nodes. The puppet config option to enable
this functionality is 'enable_docker_registry'.

The RPM dependencies for docker-registry not already included in instack
is as follows:
    python-blinker
    c-ares
    python-gunicorn
    libev
    python-gevent
    python-backports-lzma
    m2crypto

The registry default port of 5000 conflicts with keystone, so it has
been changed to 8787 instead. Iptables rule for port 8787 has been added
to allow outside access.

Change-Id: I40e871f9017315886b1aac256f3fd6b9778ac21b
(cherry picked from commit 623be791cea48583d50779cef1649508e912817f)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-16 17:03:21.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow ctlplane network or ID, and default to "ctlplane"

Currently you always have to pass the ctlplane ID because we're still
using the deprecated network_id property for the neutron port resource.

Since Juno, heat has supported a "network" property, which is used
elsewhere, e.g the nested port stacks, so switch to using it in the
overcloud-without-mergepy template, and flip the default to a more
useful "ctlplane" vs an empty string.

This means the stack create should just work on commonly documented
deployments without requiring any parameter.

Change-Id: Ifcea36d26b795c5e8b80accd8112e23b254127be
(cherry picked from 0d191cb5d626c19ea9496a4f0a1423f2ff3ed5c9)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow ctlplane network or ID, and default to "ctlplane"

Currently you always have to pass the ctlplane ID because we're still
using the deprecated network_id property for the neutron port resource.

Since Juno, heat has supported a "network" property, which is used
elsewhere, e.g the nested port stacks, so switch to using it in the
overcloud-without-mergepy template, and flip the default to a more
useful "ctlplane" vs an empty string.

This means the stack create should just work on commonly documented
deployments without requiring any parameter.

Change-Id: Ifcea36d26b795c5e8b80accd8112e23b254127be
(cherry picked from 0d191cb5d626c19ea9496a4f0a1423f2ff3ed5c9)

commit_message:
Stop using versioned novaclient in func tests

Stop importing the versioned client and instead use the client.Client()
class to select the correct version.  The versioned client appears to be
removed from newer novaclient, breaking our tests.

Change-Id: I968be1d5c095027175d3d3c96a7e5d574b580ad7

commit_message:
Fix boolean conditionals for Ansible 2.0 with git repo copies

Repository copies were failing on Ansible 2.0 due to the conditional
include containing an or statement with shorthand boolean true
statements. This apparently is problematic, and adding the longer
conditional expression worked as expected.

Additionally, this commit serves as a canary for an upcoming
python-ironicclient change listed as depends-on.

Change-Id: I51a863d270aae57e76b7397cb1b83c5dbd85f867
Depends-On: Ic77a86196d5bcd956f0a3ae517200824a4d70aa8

Somehow we were reading the fine in binary which is unsupported in
python3, however as ansible support is limited to 2.7, this likely
was not noticed.

subject: pacemaker: run neutron-server-start-wait-stop only at step 4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 11:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'pacemaker: run neutron-server-start-wait-stop only at step 4

neutron-server-start-wait-stop is a dangerous Exec that is exposed to
race conditions, because it does not have "onlyif" or "unless"
statements.

That means during a deployment, this exec can be run in the wrong order
during Step 5 and/or 6, while it was supposed to be run at Step 4 only.
If that happens, the exec will fail because puppet tries to start
neutron-server while Pacemaker already started the resource. So in that
case, systemd would returns 1 to Puppet which would return 6 to the
overcloud deployment and the deployment would fail to finish correctly.

This patch aims to prevent from this scenario by making sure we run the
exec only during the step 4.

Also, in order to secure it a bit more, we add 'unless' statement to
this exec, so we would make sure the Puppet run would be idempotent and
the Exec would run one successful time only.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1290582

Change-Id: I42813c5cff6c525c15c9c24baad4e355f88af672
(cherry picked from commit 676ec6ea6d7995266b8162c8caa89f72693eb929)
'}]
commit_message:
pacemaker: run neutron-server-start-wait-stop only at step 4

neutron-server-start-wait-stop is a dangerous Exec that is exposed to
race conditions, because it does not have "onlyif" or "unless"
statements.

That means during a deployment, this exec can be run in the wrong order
during Step 5 and/or 6, while it was supposed to be run at Step 4 only.
If that happens, the exec will fail because puppet tries to start
neutron-server while Pacemaker already started the resource. So in that
case, systemd would returns 1 to Puppet which would return 6 to the
overcloud deployment and the deployment would fail to finish correctly.

This patch aims to prevent from this scenario by making sure we run the
exec only during the step 4.

Also, in order to secure it a bit more, we add 'unless' statement to
this exec, so we would make sure the Puppet run would be idempotent and
the Exec would run one successful time only.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1290582

Change-Id: I42813c5cff6c525c15c9c24baad4e355f88af672
(cherry picked from commit 676ec6ea6d7995266b8162c8caa89f72693eb929)

subject: Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 14:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

The neutron pcs constraints were reworked in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229466/

For overclouds deployed with older tripleo-heat-templates the
current pcs ordering constraints will not have those changes,
meaning that the behaviour discussed at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1501378 is likely
given we will stop and restart all services. This review
applies those, in short, remove the ovs-cleanup after
neutron-server and add openvswitch-agent instead. Detail in
the bug report and linked BZ.

Change-Id: I45822c5fe9029f11635400b7fbd386880ac80a4e
Related-Bug: 1501378
(cherry picked from commit f070fa189c8f218f979263816975fdfa13451623)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

The neutron pcs constraints were reworked in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229466/

For overclouds deployed with older tripleo-heat-templates the
current pcs ordering constraints will not have those changes,
meaning that the behaviour discussed at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1501378 is likely
given we will stop and restart all services. This review
applies those, in short, remove the ovs-cleanup after
neutron-server and add openvswitch-agent instead. Detail in
the bug report and linked BZ.

Change-Id: I45822c5fe9029f11635400b7fbd386880ac80a4e
Related-Bug: 1501378
(cherry picked from commit f070fa189c8f218f979263816975fdfa13451623)

subject: Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 14:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

See https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/248931

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302
(cherry picked from commit 0d12f977e6c59f0425da24edbffc0632fcae71b4)
'}]
commit_message:
Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

See https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/248931

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302
(cherry picked from commit 0d12f977e6c59f0425da24edbffc0632fcae71b4)

This change will have no effect on an existing overcloud as the current

Change-Id: I5c2a2d2170714093c5757282cba12ac65f8738a4

commit_message:
Add SoftwareConfigTransport for switching transports

This change adds a SoftwareConfigTransport parameter to role templates
so that the transport can be changed via a parameter_defaults entry.

This change will have no effect on an existing overcloud as the current
default POLL_SERVER_CFN is now explicit in the parameter default.

Change-Id: I5c2a2d2170714093c5757282cba12ac65f8738a4

subject: Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 15:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['environments/updates/update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml', 'environments/updates/README.md'], 'message': "Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5
(cherry picked from commit d3145e0624088be12eb3276168d17cd33d4c9231)
"}]
commit_message:
Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5
(cherry picked from commit d3145e0624088be12eb3276168d17cd33d4c9231)

commit_message:
Adding linters target to tox.ini

This commit adds the linters target to Bandit.  The idea is that
we will add a linters target that runs both the pep8 checks and
Bandit baseline.  A new commit will add the 'linters' target to
infra.

* Identify the apropriate error for snapshot limit from the array
  and raise the right error to invalidate the cache.
* Add an optional limit to the number of snapshot taken from the
  volume representing a cached image
* Add unittest for snapshot limit

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic15257c9409373a4883870681d1412161cd3437c
Closes-Bug: #1519843
'}]
commit_message:
XtremIO: fix generic glance cache with XtremIO

* Identify the apropriate error for snapshot limit from the array
  and raise the right error to invalidate the cache.
* Add an optional limit to the number of snapshot taken from the
  volume representing a cached image
* Add unittest for snapshot limit

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic15257c9409373a4883870681d1412161cd3437c
Closes-Bug: #1519843

Single field added to AutoSupport data key-value pair.
AutoSupport is a mechanism that allows NetApp backends
to report customer usage metrics.

Change-Id: I4c1dae89505767acd579e874fbe541d4617915f2
'}]
commit_message:
Add serial number to eseries ASUP payload

Single field added to AutoSupport data key-value pair.
AutoSupport is a mechanism that allows NetApp backends
to report customer usage metrics.

Change-Id: I4c1dae89505767acd579e874fbe541d4617915f2

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-12-11 06:11:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vnx.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vnx_cli.py'], 'message': "VNX: Fix failure in SnapCopy feature

Previously, user needs to enable this feature via Volume Type.
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184733/

This introduces some failures for volume operations, for example:

1. Creating cloned volume or snapshot from snapcopy volume will fail.
2. Creating volume from snapshot whose source volume's volume type is
snapcopy type will fail.
3. Creating non-snapcopy volume from source volume with snapcopy type
will fail.

In order to fix above issues, Driver needs to store the base LUN info
for all volumes. When creating cloned volume or volume from snapshot
, driver extracts the base LUN info and creates snapshot mount point
according to the base LUN and then exposes as a snapcopy volume.

Example cinder command to enable snapcopy on volume:

    cinder create --source-volid <vol-id> --metadata snapcopy=True
or

    cinder create --snapshot-id <snap-id> --metadata snapcopy=True

liberty-backport-potential
DocImpact
Change-Id: I91c83ddac9bcad9c7c788d7bf82bcc4dced71751
Closes-Bug: 1514319"}]
commit_message:
VNX: Fix failure in SnapCopy feature

Previously, user needs to enable this feature via Volume Type.
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184733/

This introduces some failures for volume operations, for example:

1. Creating cloned volume or snapshot from snapcopy volume will fail.
2. Creating volume from snapshot whose source volume's volume type is
snapcopy type will fail.
3. Creating non-snapcopy volume from source volume with snapcopy type
will fail.

In order to fix above issues, Driver needs to store the base LUN info
for all volumes. When creating cloned volume or volume from snapshot
, driver extracts the base LUN info and creates snapshot mount point
according to the base LUN and then exposes as a snapcopy volume.

Example cinder command to enable snapcopy on volume:

    cinder create --source-volid <vol-id> --metadata snapcopy=True
or

    cinder create --snapshot-id <snap-id> --metadata snapcopy=True

liberty-backport-potential
DocImpact
Change-Id: I91c83ddac9bcad9c7c788d7bf82bcc4dced71751
Closes-Bug: 1514319

commit_message:
Port zonemanager to Python 3

* Replace xrange() with six.moves.range()
* Replace filter() with list-comprehension to get a list on Python 3.
* get_formatted_wwn(): join byte strings with b':' instead of ':'
* ZoneManager: don't pass arguments to object.__new__()
* tests-py3.txt: add zonemanager tests

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Ia3fcd816c5afd7a08b8769fbc9d2839b70c8c3fb

commit_message:
Remove downgrade migrations

According to cross project spec[1] downgrade migrations should be removed.

[1] I622f89fe63327d44f9b229d3bd9e76e15acbaa7a

Implements blueprint: no-downward-sql-migration

Change-Id: I111cdb4bba361de5da0ce7db8144965c947ada41

commit_message:
move usage_audit to cmd/eventlet package

    setup_rpc func need the eventlet monkey_patch,
    otherwise the main process will be blocked.

Change-Id: I9f4a0b7c957b7dc7740e3cf6e75f18778ad562d0
Closes-Bug: #1522681
(cherry picked from commit 5b6992db49cf6e69b05411ed7d170198434f39e9)

commit_message:
Streamline pip installs

We currently have a bunch of plays to install python
packages either from PyPi or source checkouts. Create
a parameterized include playbook to streamline the main
install role playbook. Also get rid of dib_install.yml
since we can use this new playbook instead.

Change-Id: I33bd94bcfc7577ee863af4cd480b096096ab2472

commit_message:
Turn off -e in check-git-commit-message.sh

The script exits with the appropriate code depending on the result
of the test. No need to abort on any particular non-zero status.

Change-Id: Ifcdbb322edc9709c8004f1ceda2973a24b7246f0
